{"products":[{"id":4475657125967,"title":"Wailea Blue Nine Holes","handle":"wailea-blue-nine-holes","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6545 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. </b></p>\n<div></div>\n<div>Wailea Blue offers up a golf experience that is truly classic. As the first course ever built in Wailea, The Blue laid claim to the lay of the land that would put Wailea on everyone’s wish list of places to visit.  <br> </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The course winds its way on a tour of the resort while serving up views of the neighboring islands on one side and 10,023-foot dormant volcano, Mt. Haleakala on the other. Now, after all these years, The  Blue continues to welcome back many golfers who feel that a trip to Maui is not complete without a round or two on The Blue course. <br> </div>\n<div>With views of the Pacific Ocean, several offshore islands, a volcanic cinder cone known as Pu'u Olai and majestic Mount Haleakala, it features several fountains and lakes and an abundance of colorful Hibiscus, Wiliwili Trees, Bougainvillea and Plumeria, not to mention lush, wide fairways and large greens. With all of these aspects as well as superb course conditions the Wailea Blue really is the definition of classic golf in paradise.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span><span color=\"#ff0000\" style=\"color: #ff0000;\">  </span></span></b></p>\n<p><span>The \"Ocean Course\" at Hokuala (Formerly known as Kauai Lagoons) is a lush, 750-acre resort carefully secluded in the southwest corner of the island of Kauai, Hawaii. Fairways weave through mango and guava tree forests along imposing ocean cliffs and over promontories high above the harbor.</span><br><br><span>It is said that when legendary golfer and architect Jack Nicklaus created the original Kiele Course in the late 1980's, the terrain lent itself so well to his vision that he made but a single change to his original design. In 2011, Jack Nicklaus was again called upon</span><span>, t</span><span>his time to redesign the back nine of his famed Kiele course. Included are all new greens, new white silica sand bunkers and three new holes. Arguably the best new feature is an </span><span>additional </span><span>ocean hole that is now the centerpiece of what is the l</span><em>ongest stretch of continuous ocean holes of any course in Hawaii</em><span>, now making four fabulous holes which provide over 1/2 mile of unobstructed oceanfront.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table yards. All prices per person and include <span style=\"color: #ff2a00;\">9 Holes</span> golf cart rental.</b></p>\n<p>Kiahuna Golf Club is located in sunny Poipu Beach and surrounded by the lush, natural beauty of Kauai. Architect Robert Trent Jones Jr. skillfully included many ancient remnants of an authentic Hawaiian Village into his vision when designing the course. </p>\n<div></div>\n<div>Kiahuna Golf Club offers challenging resort golf within a fascinating area of ancient Polynesian archaeology, as it is structured around the remains of authentic Hawaiian culture. This challenging course has narrow fairways and you will encounter unusual obstacles such as lava walls and stone structures.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Kiahuna Golf Club is a sanctuary for many of Kauai’s endangered species including the state bird of Hawaii, the Nene. The Black-Crowned Night Heron can be seen fishing along the clubs numerous water hazards. Golfers may also spot the rare Hawaiian Stilt and the very shy Moorhen along Waikomo Stream.</div>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table Made Golf Clubs"]}]},{"id":141553347,"title":"Turtle Bay Palmer FT","handle":"turtle-bay-palmer-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7218 yards. All prices per person and include golf, cart rental and range balls. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span><br><br></span></span></b></p>\n<p>Located on Oahu's scenic North Shore, perhaps better known for surfing than golfing, the prominent Turtle Bay Palmer Golf Course has hosted Champions Tour and LPGA events as well as the Golf Channel’s <em>Big Break</em>.</p>\n<p>The Palmer Course at Turtle Bay is an 18-hole Championship Golf Course designed by Arnold Palmer and Ed Seay. The course features two distinctly different experiences. The front nine is nearly devoid of trees and shrubs but rather features sand, water and rolling terrain. The back nine though plays through a forest of ironwood pines and offers a very different feel. The 17th hole marks the eminent signature hole with a total of nine craggy bunkers surrounding the landing area and extending all the way up to the green, which sits on a plateau only 100 feet from the ocean.</p>\n<p>The Palmer Course is the more challenging of the two courses at Turtle Bay and plays to a yardage of just over 7200 yards from the back tees with a slope of 141.<span> </span>The course conditions are always perfect with carpet like fairways and extremely fast, true greens. This course is a must play when on Oahu!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" 1pm"]}]},{"id":3975222722639,"title":"Hoakalei Country Club.","handle":"hoakalei-country-club-2","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7,413 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p><span>\"Hoakalei Country Club\" is the latest golf course on the island of Oahu, designed by “The Big Easy” himself, Ernie Els, with his vision of hosting PGA events.<br>This highly praised and exciting championship course suits golfers of every caliber, from amateurs to professionals.</span></p>\n<p><span>The 7,413-yard champion course designed by Ernie Els is a challenging course with back tees covering a range of 6,732 yards and regular tees spanning 6,226 yards, as well as generously wide fairways, allowing you to swing your driver with confidence.</span></p>\n<p><span>There are 114 strategically placed bunkers throughout the course, and risk-reward shots are challenging but extremely satisfying. Mr. Els designed this course to suit every golfer, whether amateur or professional, with beautiful water features—some being troublesome. The hole layout has been configured in conjunction with the trade winds, which means Hoakalei is the type of course that could play different from day to day. </span></p>\n<p><span>Hoakalei challenges golfers in their play. With the effect of Oahu’s unique trade winds, reading the ripples of the ponds and striking the ball cleanly down the fairway is a thrill in itself.</span></p>\n<p><span>Enjoy a spectacular time with precious friends and family at a refreshing site integrated with nature. Simple, yet modern, Hoakalei Country Club delivers moments that are “True” against a stunning canvas of “Blue.</span></p>\n<p><span>Hoakalei Country Club is a pleasant combination of beautiful Hawaii and luxurious championship golf.</span></p>\n<p><span>A private country club surrounded by beautiful blue skies and the stunning colors of rich green panoramic views. Spending quality time in this true “paradise” will surely be a delight. The country club features not only a golf course, but a new club house with a swimming pool where you can cool down and relax while reading your favorite book. You can also spend quality time with your family and enjoy the cabanas.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table Title"]}]},{"id":114786288,"title":"Turtle Bay Fazio FT","handle":"turtle-bay-fazio-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p>18<b> holes, par 72, 6769 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and range balls.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Located on Oahu's scenic North Shore, perhaps better known for surfing than golfing, the Turtle Bay Resort offers two acclaimed courses that have played host to both Champions Tour and LPGA events, as well as the Golf Channel’s <em>The Big Break</em>.</p>\n<p>The Fazio Course, considered the less demanding of the two Turtle Bay Courses, was designed by George Fazio and features generous fairways and a length of just over 6700 from the back tees.<span> </span>The greens are not nearly as guarded as its sister course and can be enjoyed by players of all levels. This course was the site of the inaugural Champions Tour Skins Game which featured Arnold Palmer, Sam Snead, Gary Player and Chi Chi Rodriguez.</p>\n<p>The course indisputably offers some of the best ocean views in all of Oahu. Holes 6,7,11 and 12 are situated merely feet from the beautiful Pacific Ocean. This is certainly one of the best deals you'll find for golf on Oahu. </p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" href=\"#details\">Course Details</a> | <a href=\"#scorecard\">Scorecard</a> | <a href=\"#layout\">Layout</a></p>\n<p><b>27 holes A/B/C, par 72, 7117-7255 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.</b></p>\n<p>Located about 40 minutes from Waikiki on the Ewa Plains, Hawaii Prince is an Arnold Palmer designed facility, featuring 27 holes.<span>  </span>Each of the 9’s are designated A, B or C, and the abundant number of water features is the dominant characteristic of this track.<span>  </span>Within the property of the golf course there are 10 lakes, which come in to play in over half of the holes.<span>  </span></p>\n<p>In addition to its 27 holes the Hawaii Prince Golf Club sports an excellent practice facility and features a full service clubhouse with a terrific restaurant.<span>  </span>The golf course is affiliated with the Hawaii Prince hotel, and features a shuttle service for those interested.</p>\n<b> </b> <!--Paste Golf Clubs"]}]},{"id":409984156,"title":"Hapuna Special","handle":"hapuna-special","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6875 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><br></b>Hapuna Golf Course offers spectacular views of the Kohala Coast and the Pacific Ocean while majestic Mauna Kea, Mauna Loa, and Kohala Mountains form the backdrop. With its seemingly endless views and dramatic elevation changes beginning at sea level and rising to 700 feet, Hapuna Golf Course nestles into the rugged desert terrain above the west shore of Hawaii's Big Island. <br><br>This Arnold Palmer / Ed Seay course is a championship \"links-style\" design that was built in 1992 and stretches to just under 6,900 yards. The Pacific Ocean serves as the picture perfect backdrop and can be seen from every hole. Teeing off at just under 700 feet of elevation, the signature par 4, 12th hole provides one of the most spectacular panoramic views on the Big Island - including Maui in the distance.<br><br>Hapuna Golf Course has gained a reputation as a hidden gem and for that reason is always a local favorite. Hapuna's challenging play and environmental sensitivity make it one of Hawaii's most unique golf courses..</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course 1pm"]}]},{"id":2349590937679,"title":"Turtle Bay Palmer","handle":"turtle-bay-palmer-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7218 yards. All prices per person and include golf, cart rental and range balls. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span><br><br></span></span></b></p>\n<p>Located on Oahu's scenic North Shore, perhaps better known for surfing than golfing, the prominent Turtle Bay Palmer Golf Course has hosted Champions Tour and LPGA events as well as the Golf Channel’s <em>Big Break</em>.</p>\n<p>The Palmer Course at Turtle Bay is an 18-hole Championship Golf Course designed by Arnold Palmer and Ed Seay. The course features two distinctly different experiences. The front nine is nearly devoid of trees and shrubs but rather features sand, water and rolling terrain. The back nine though plays through a forest of ironwood pines and offers a very different feel. The 17th hole marks the eminent signature hole with a total of nine craggy bunkers surrounding the landing area and extending all the way up to the green, which sits on a plateau only 100 feet from the ocean.</p>\n<p>The Palmer Course is the more challenging of the two courses at Turtle Bay and plays to a yardage of just over 7200 yards from the back tees with a slope of 141.<span> </span>The course conditions are always perfect with carpet like fairways and extremely fast, true greens. This course is a must play when on Oahu!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" 1pm","Blackout"]}]},{"id":2349496827983,"title":"Turtle Bay Fazio","handle":"turtle-bay-fazio-golf-course","body_html":"<p>18<b> holes, par 72, 6769 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and range balls.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Located on Oahu's scenic North Shore, perhaps better known for surfing than golfing, the Turtle Bay Resort offers two acclaimed courses that have played host to both Champions Tour and LPGA events, as well as the Golf Channel’s <em>The Big Break</em>.</p>\n<p>The Fazio Course, considered the less demanding of the two Turtle Bay Courses, was designed by George Fazio and features generous fairways and a length of just over 6700 from the back tees.<span> </span>The greens are not nearly as guarded as its sister course and can be enjoyed by players of all levels. This course was the site of the inaugural Champions Tour Skins Game which featured Arnold Palmer, Sam Snead, Gary Player and Chi Chi Rodriguez.</p>\n<p>The course indisputably offers some of the best ocean views in all of Oahu. Holes 6,7,11 and 12 are situated merely feet from the beautiful Pacific Ocean. This is certainly one of the best deals you'll find for golf on Oahu. </p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 57-091 Kamehameha Hwy, Kahuku, Oahu, Hawaii</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: George Fazio</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Travis Joerger</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1972</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Larry Keil</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6769/6091/5354</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope: 130/124/122</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating: 73.8/70.0/71.1</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts:  yes</td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Title","option2":null,"option3":null,"sku":"","requires_shipping":false,"taxable":true,"featured_image":null,"available":true,"price":"53.00","grams":0,"compare_at_price":null,"position":1,"product_id":1487469248591,"created_at":"2018-10-11T14:08:30-10:00","updated_at":"2018-10-12T14:17:16-10:00"}],"images":[],"options":[{"name":"Title","position":1,"values":["Default Title"]}]},{"id":1315848486991,"title":"Ko'olau Golf Club","handle":"koolau-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7310 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rentals &amp; range balls. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Carved out of a magnificent tropical forest, Ko'olau Golf Club is one of the most inspiring golf experiences you will play anywhere in the world. Ko'olau is nestled below Oahu's historic and popular Pali Lookout, and offers breathtaking views of the majestic 2,000-foot-high cliffs of the Ko'olau Mountain Range, cascading waterfalls and calming views of the beautiful windward side of Oahu.</p>\n<p>Ko'olau's natural setting provided master golf course architect Dick Nugent the opportunity to create a gem of a golf course that encompasses over 280 acres of spectacular terrain with a scenic 7310 yard, par-72 layout unlike any other in the world.<span>  </span></p>\n<p>Considered by many the toughest golf course on the planet, Ko'olau was originally pegged with a slope of 162 from the back tees but later dropped to 152, just three points shy of the maximum value acknowledged in the slope rating system. Due to Ko'olau's alluring scenery and uniqueness it comes as no surprise that it is commonly found at the top of golf course lists created by trusted names in golf such as <em>Golf Magazine</em> and <em>Golf Digest</em>. </p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" 2 Day SPECIAL","Oahu Island Challenge","Blackout","Morning","After 11 am","After 2 pm","Morning."]}]},{"id":548496260,"title":"Mauna Kea Golf Special (until Dec 15)","handle":"mauna-kea-golf-special","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7370 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. </b></p>\n<div>The multi-award winning Golf Course at Mauna Kea has since 1964, led the way in standards of course beauty and design, solidifying its place in Hawaii's history as one of the most scenic and favored golf courses.<br><br>Created by Robert Trent Jones Sr., the 18-hole championship course presents dramatic elevation changes, large undulating greens and 120 well-placed bunkers. <br><br>Without changing the essential character of his father's design, Rees Jones Inc. re-planted the Championship Course with highly efficient ultra-dwarf Tifeagle Bermudagrass on the greens and Tifway 419 hybrid Bermudagrass on the tees, fairways and roughs. State-of-the-art irrigation systems, liners in the bunkers, and advance drainage improvements keep the golf course in top shape and save on environmental resources.<br><br>Including world-class practice facilities, that features a driving range and putting green to elevate your game while enjoying epic views of the Kohala Coast and its rolling waves. Golfers can also gather together at the new Number 3 Restaurant after golf to relax in a casual atmosphere with a signature Mauna Kea cocktail to toast a great round of golf.<br><br>With incredible panoramic views of sea and land, featuring snow-capped Mauna Kea, rugged lava beds, and the sparkling blue Pacific. The spectacular signature hole is the famous Third Hole - where surging inlet water races to meet the rocky shoreline, affording one of the most dramatic and breathtaking views in golf today.</div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr Morning (after 11am)","Super Twilight after 2:30pm"]}]},{"id":1321387950159,"title":"Ko Olina Golf Club","handle":"ko-olina-golf-club","body_html":"<p><strong>18</strong><b> holes, par 72, 6867 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\">(If you need transportation, we require 24 hours notice).</span></span></b></p>\n<p>Ko Olina has been recognized by <em>Golf Digest</em> as one of the \"Top 75 Resort Courses in the USA\". The course includes 16 water features on 8 different holes, multi-tiered greens and well-manicured fairways. Ko Olina will challenge golfers to use every club in the bag with its demanding par-3's, well bunkered greens and gentle trade winds.</p>\n<p>Located on the west coast of the island inside the Ko Olina Resort, the Ted Robinson designed course is one of the only resort courses located on Oahu.<span>  </span>The par-72 layout features generous landing areas, cascading waterfalls and a picturesque ocean location. From the back tees Ko Olina measures 6867 yards and is always superbly maintained.</p>\n<p>Ko Olina opened in January 1990, hosting the LPGA Tour's Hawaiian Ladies Open from 1990 to 1995, the Senior PGA Tour's Ko Olina Senior Invitational in 1992 and the Fields Open in Hawaii from 2006 to 2008. Ko Olina is also home to the LPGA LOTTE Championship, which returned in 2012 and takes place every April. This years winner (2018) was Brooke Henderson with a winning score of -12 or 276.</p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span><span color=\"#ff0000\" style=\"color: #ff0000;\">  </span></span></b></p>\n<p><span>The \"Ocean Course\" at Hokuala (Formerly known as Kauai Lagoons) is a lush, 750-acre resort carefully secluded in the southwest corner of the island of Kauai, Hawaii. Fairways weave through mango and guava tree forests along imposing ocean cliffs and over promontories high above the harbor..</span><br><br><span>It is said that when legendary golfer and architect Jack Nicklaus created the original Kiele Course in the late 1980's, the terrain lent itself so well to his vision that he made but a single change to his original design. In 2011, Jack Nicklaus was again called upon</span><span>, t</span><span>his time to redesign the back nine of his famed Kiele course. Included are all new greens, new white silica sand bunkers and three new holes. Arguably the best new feature is an </span><span>additional </span><span>ocean hole that is now the centerpiece of what is the l</span><em>ongest stretch of continuous ocean holes of any course in Hawaii</em><span>, now making four fabulous holes which provide over 1/2 mile of unobstructed oceanfront.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table 19)"]}]},{"id":214664642569,"title":"Kona Country Club","handle":"kona-country-club-ocean-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6613 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. <br> </b></p>\n<p>The William Bell designed Ocean Course was built in 1966, and maintains its charm by incorporating natural settings along the Pacific Ocean and gorgeous mountain views. Being so close to the ocean you may even get sprayed by the ocean mist on picturesque ocean signature holes #3, #12 and #13. Enjoy seeing the grand splash on hole #13 where you will see the impressive blow hole known as “puka” in Hawaiian.</p>\n<p>Keep a lookout for Humpback Whales during November through March. This 18 hole championship course offers wide, lush fairways, Bermuda Grass greens and numerous sand bunkers. The only natural obstacles are the turquoise blue water and lava rocks.</p>\n<p>You'll know why this course was chosen as one of the top 100 courses by <em>Golf Digest.</em> <em>Golf for Women Magazine</em>, <em>ESPN</em> and <em>ZAGAT Guide</em> also has recognized Kona Ocean Country Club as one of nation's top golf facilities and it maintains an \"excellent\" rating by players of America's top golf courses.</p>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" Special","handle":"maui-nui-golf-course-10am-special","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6801 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <br><br></b><strong>Maui Nui Golf Club</strong> located in Kihei, is suitable for any player or skill-level. Features include an inviting opening hole, reachable par 5's, exceptional views of the Pacific Ocean, Mt. Haleakala, Molokini and the West Maui Mountains.<br><br>The course is continually being improved to make it even more golfer friendly, with widening of the fairways, reshaping and enlarging of greens and the installation of a new hybrid Bermuda turf grass. Maui Nui is not only one of the best value courses but has some of the best weather on the island as well.</p>\n<p>Maui Nui, originally known as Silversword, was designed by architect Bill Newis and first opened in 1987. With an interesting layout, the course was designed with the trade winds in mind, which usually hit the course in the late afternoon. Maui Nui rewards those who play the fundamentals well: keeping the ball in play, putting, chipping and playing within themselves; it is the fairest test of golf on Maui. </p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 470 Lipoa am - 10 am Special","Blackout","11:30 am - 12 pm  Special","Morning Special"]}]},{"id":214673948681,"title":"Maui Nui Golf Course","handle":"maui-nui-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6801 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <br><br></b><strong>Maui Nui Golf Club</strong> located in Kihei, is suitable for any player or skill-level. Features include an inviting opening hole, reachable par 5's, exceptional views of the Pacific Ocean, Mt. Haleakala, Molokini and the West Maui Mountains.<br><br>The course is continually being improved to make it even more golfer friendly, with widening of the fairways, reshaping and enlarging of greens and the installation of a new hybrid Bermuda turf grass. Maui Nui is not only one of the best value courses but has some of the best weather on the island as well.</p>\n<p>Maui Nui, originally known as Silversword, was designed by architect Bill Newis and first opened in 1987. With an interesting layout, the course was designed with the trade winds in mind, which usually hit the course in the late afternoon. Maui Nui rewards those who play the fundamentals well: keeping the ball in play, putting, chipping and playing within themselves; it is the fairest test of golf on Maui.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 470 Lipoa Club","handle":"waikele-golf-course","body_html":"<p><span style=\"background-color: #000000;\"></span><strong>18</strong><b> holes, par 72, 6663 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b></p>\n<p>Waikele Country Club is only 30 minutes west of Waikiki. The beautiful par  72 Ted Robinson designed course is an impeccably manicured track that provides challenges and enjoyment to players of all skill levels.</p>\n<p>The course boasts spectacular views of Diamond Head, Pearl Harbor, and the Ko'olau and Waianae mountains. Waikele features rolling fairways, undulating Tiff Eagle greens, strategically placed bunkers, and a generous compliment of water features.</p>\n<p><span>A truly comprehensive country club, Waikele Country Club features a golf shop with the finest names in equipment and apparel, locker rooms, a restaurant, and a full-service driving range, and putting areas.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here Island Challenge","Morning","Twilight 12:30 pm","Mornings","Twilight."]}]},{"id":213842821129,"title":"Waikoloa Village","handle":"waikoloa-village-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6791 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span><br><br></b>The second oldest course on the Big Island and a local favorite, Waikoloa Village Golf Club is situated in an arid location, nestled in the foothills of Mauna Kea overlooking the Pacific Ocean, which virtually assures good playing conditions 365 days per year.<br><br>This Robert Trent Jones Jr. designed course features generous fairways with wide, forgiving landing areas which encourage aggressive tee shots and the large and well well-bunkered, undulating greens provide a test for any level of golfer. Located at approximately 1,000 feet of elevation, golfers are treated to views of five volcanoes - Kohala, Mauna Kea, Mauna Loa, Hualalai and Haleakala on Maui as well as the Kohala coastline.<br><br>The course is challenging enough for the serious golfer, but fun for beginners as well. The 6791-yard par-72 course has all of the feel of a Jones design, with additional challenges unique to this island landscape. Waikoloa Village Golf Course fits harmoniously into the natural beauty of the setting. One of Hawaii's best-kept secrets, with practice facilities and a pro shop stocked with golf equipment and accessories the Waikoloa Village Golf Course is a great place to practice, shop and most of all play golf.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr Challenge","Blackout","Morning","After 2:30 pm","Morning (from Apr 1)","After 2:30 pm (from Apr 1)"]}]},{"id":214663888905,"title":"The Dunes","handle":"the-dunes-at-maui-lani","body_html":"<div><b>18 holes, par 72, 6841 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> <br></span></b></div>\n<div>The Dunes at Maui Lani Golf Course is built on million-year old sand dunes located in central Maui. Architect Robin Nelson loved this natural setting so much that he left the topography of the unspoiled dunes terrain alone when crafting this links-style course. The Dunes plays 6841 yards from the Black Tees and has a USGA Slope Rating of 141.  </div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Dunes at Maui Lani is designed much like the courses in the British Isles that were built centuries ago, as its holes take full advantage of Maui’s sloping island dune terrain. Each of the 18 holes are unique compared to anything else found in America because of the terrain upon which they are set and therefore make this course one-of-a-kind to play.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div>In addition to the incomparable course itself you will find that The Dunes has the only lit range with grass tees in all of central Maui, making it a great place to practice after hours as well. </div>\n<div></div>\n<p><br> <a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" 12 pm","Late Twilight after 3 pm","Thursday Special (until Dec 26th)","Tuesday Special"]}]},{"id":214669590537,"title":"Makalei Golf Club","handle":"makalei-golf-club","body_html":"<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\"><b>18 holes, par 72, 7091 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. </b></span></div>\n<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\"><b></b></span></div>\n<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\"><b></b></span></div>\n<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\"></span></div>\n<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\">At Makalei Golf Club Kona golf enthusiasts will appreciate the indigenous flora and fauna of the area, which includes many native species of plants as well as numerous peacocks, pheasants, wild turkeys and other wildlife. While the native plants and animals are enough for most people to enjoy the experience, Makalei also vaunts a spectacular view of Hawaii Island as well as one of Mount Haleakala on the island of Maui.<br><br>The par 72 golf layout is a scenic, lush forest alternative to the island’s coastal golf and will offer a great challenge for golfers of all skill levels. Situated in the Kona region on the west side of Hawaii Island, known for its cool climates and world famous coffee farms, Makalei boasts an elevation range from 1,800 to 2,850 feet. Several distinctive features on the course include Bentgrass greens, lava tubes, cinder cones and a stone wall dating back more than a century. Take some time to appreciate the many birds and spectacular views of the coastline throughout the course.<br><br>Makalei is a short drive straight up the mountain from the Kona International Airport and is easily accessible from all of the major resorts and destinations on the Island of Hawaii. Makalei offers player friendly prices, which make it one of the most affordable golf courses on the island. Makalei is truly one of the most unique golf courses in the world as it encompasses all of the serenity and challenge that the Island of Hawaii has to offer.</span></div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course 12 pm","Blackout","Kona Challenge"]}]},{"id":213843312649,"title":"Waikoloa Kings","handle":"waikoloa-kings-golf-course","body_html":"<p>18<b> holes, par 72, 7074 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. </b></p>\n<p>Waikoloa Kings Golf Course is truly a player’s course. It has length and lingering trade winds that can pick up in the late afternoon. This alone would be enough to challenge a good player, yet the course also is known for its unique lava landscape which can definitely be a considerable distraction.<br><br>Designed by the team of Tom Weiskopf and Jay Morrish the 7074 yard Kings Course meanders over and around the ancient black lava flow, and its wide, undulating fairways are framed by palm trees and vibrant flowers of Hawaii. The beautiful Kings Course plays inland towards the ancient mountain of Mauna Kea, ever present in the distance.<br><br>From the 5th hole green, perched up a few feet above the fairway golfers get a magnificent view of the surrounding lava fields, which stretch as far as the eye can see. This is camera time no matter what your score. Majestic fairways interspersed throughout ancient lava fields – it has even been compared to playing golf on the moon!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table Club","handle":"mililani-golf-club","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6455 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b></p>\n<p><span>Nestled on a plateau, with the Waianae Mountains and the Ko'olau Mountains stretching away in the distance, Mililani Golf Club provides a \"get away from it all\" feeling of remoteness.  The Bob Baldock design features Norfolk Pines, Eucalyptus trees, African Tulip trees, and lush tropical Hawaiian foliage, in bloom all year round.</span><span>   </span><br><br><span>Mililani Golf Club offers a driving range, chipping green, and two putting greens conveniently located near the clubhouse.</span><span>   </span><span>Just a short 30-minute drive from Waikiki located in the quiet community of Mililani, which means \"beloved heaven\" in Hawaiian.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 95-176 Kuahelani Ave Mililiani Hawaii 96789</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Bob Baldock  </td>\n<td>Director of Golf:  Darren Sumimoto</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1966</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Andy Meikle</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 Holes Par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage:  6455/6239/5756</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope:  124/121/117</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: 00,"height":450}],"options":[{"name":"Title","position":1,"values":["Morning","Twilight (after 1:30 pm)","Aeration Blackout","Aloha Challenge"]}]},{"id":213852127241,"title":"Waikoloa Beach","handle":"waikoloa-beach-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 70, 6566 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <br></b>Designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr., the Beach Course at Waikoloa winds its way along historic lava flows near Anaehoomalu Bay. The Beach course truly has it all, a great mix of challenging holes with birdie opportunities, spectacular scenery and a layout strategic enough to challenge the pro’s while gentle enough to allow even the casual player an enjoyable day on the course. <br><br>Waikoloa Beach Golf Course offers some of the most stunning views of any course in the world. The whole course sits on a lava peninsula surrounded by swaying coconut palms, and beautiful visuals of emerald green carpet-like fairways contrast against the stunning blues of the Pacific Ocean that crashes against the black lava, which occasionally sends ocean mist cascading into the air.<br><br>The seventh is the Beach Courses signature hole, a classic risk/reward hole that is also one of the most photographed holes in the entire Hawaiian Islands. Hole #17 is another great hole, a wonderful par three over water surrounded by an amphitheater of black lava. You won't want to forget your camera when playing this stunning course!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 600 Waikoloa Beach Drive, Waikoloa, HI 96738</td>\n</tr>\n<tr 1981</td>\n<td>Golf Professional:  Kevin Ginoza</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole par 70</td>\n<td>Yardage:  6566/5958/5122</td>\n</tr>\n<tr Club","handle":"hawaii-prince-golf-course","body_html":"<p><strong>27</strong><b> holes A/B/C, par 72, 7117-7255 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span color=\"#ff0000\" style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> (If you need transportation, we require 24 hours notice).</span></b></p>\n<p>Designed by Arnold Palmer and Ed Seay, this unique course is the only one in Hawaii to feature 27 holes. It occupies 270 acres of sheer beauty and offers stunning views of the rain-carved Waianae Mountains.</p>\n<p>Hawaii Prince is located about 35 minutes from Waikiki on the Ewa Plains. Each of the 9’s are designated \"A\", \"B\" and \"C\", and the abundant number of water features is the dominant characteristic of this track.  Within the property of the golf course there are 10 lakes which come in to play in over half of the holes. </p>\n<p>In addition to its 27 holes the Hawaii Prince Golf Club sports an excellent practice facility and features a full service clubhouse with a terrific restaurant.  Hawaii Tee Times also offers 2 round trip transportation package specials daily to the course.</p>\n<p><strong>Transport Packages Info</strong></p>\n<p><span>The Hawaii Prince Golf Club picks up from seven hotel locations in Waikiki: Waikiki Beach Marriott, Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, Halekulani Hotel, Trolley Bus Stop (located in front of Trump Tower Waikiki), Sheraton Waikiki, Grand Islander by Hilton Vacations and the Hawaii Prince Hotel. Two shuttles are available per day. One picks up between 6:30 a.m. - 7:00 a.m. and the second shuttle picks up between 10:00 a.m. - 10:30 a.m. Single players are eligible for the transport package with Hawaii Prince. Guests will be dropped back at the same hotel location after the round. Tee times are approximately 90 minutes after the pick up time. Transport packages must be booked at least 24 hours in advance.</span></p>\n<p>For the Early shuttle - Select tee times between 8:04 a.m. - 8:44 a.m.<br>For the Later shuttle - Select tee times between 11:32 a.m. - 12:12 p.m.</p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" {"products":[{"id":213172584457,"title":"Hawaii Kai Golf Course","handle":"hawaii-kai-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6614 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><b><br></b></span></b></p>\n<p>Hawaii Kai Golf Course is located in East Honolulu, 13 miles from Waikiki. Golfers find the tropical winds blowing from the ocean not only pleasant but challenging, making the course all the more enjoyable to play.</p>\n<p>Hawaii Kai is the only golf course that can be found on the beautiful eastern coastline of Oahu, and every tee on the course offers a view of the Makapuu Cliffs, luminous Pacific Ocean and the rugged eastern coastline. Wind is a significant factor on the Championship Course, making the otherwise generous fairways a little tougher to hit.</p>\n<p>The Championship Course measures 6614 yards from the back tees and features wide fairways, large greens with well placed bunkers and beautiful views. The coastline along this area of Oahu is probably the most beautiful on the island and just the drive around Koko Head Park is an adventure. In addition to the Championship Course Hawaii Kai also offers a 18-hole 3 par golf course. (NO SINGLE BOOKINGS)</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" Links","handle":"olomana-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6306 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.  </b><b><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Located on the eastern side of the Ko' olau Mountain Range and about a 30 minute drive from Waikiki, Olomana Golf Links is a dynamic blend of links style golf in a mountain-side setting.<span>  </span>This relatively short golf course (6306 yards) offers two distinctly different nines, each equally challenging. The front nine features level fairways with a formidable water hazard at each hole while the back nine's irregular rolling hills are stippled with sand bunkers.</p>\n<p>Olomana is a favorite among the locals, and is known for its reliably sunny weather and spectacular views of the Ko' olau Mountain's in the background. Be aware of the trade winds though that typically pick up in the late afternoon which can often influence club selection and make for a more challenging game.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Golf: <span mce-data-marked=\"1\">Alex Cuevaa</span>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1967</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Ryan Adams</td>\n</tr>\n<tr (Mon-Fri)","Twilight 1 pm (Mon- Fri)","Morning Weekend (Sat & Sun & Holidays)","Twilight Weekend (Sat & Sun & Holiday)","Blackout"]}]},{"id":114786188,"title":"Olomana Golf Links ft","handle":"olomana-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6306 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b><b><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Located on the eastern side of the Ko' olau Mountain Range and about a 30 minute drive from Waikiki, Olomana Golf Links is a dynamic blend of links style golf in a mountain-side setting.<span> </span>This relatively short golf course (6306 yards) offers two distinctly different nines, each equally challenging. The front nine features level fairways with a formidable water hazard at each hole while the back nine's irregular rolling hills are stippled with sand bunkers.</p>\n<p>Olomana is a favorite among the locals, and is known for its reliably sunny weather and spectacular views of the Ko' olau Mountain's in the background. Be aware of the trade winds though that typically pick up in the late afternoon which can often influence club selection and make for a more challenging game.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Sunny Lee</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1967</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Ryan Adams</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 71</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6306/5907/5473</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope: 126/121/128</td>\n</tr>\n<tr no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Five-somes Policy: (Mon-Fri)","Twilight 1 pm (Mon- Fri)","Morning Weekend (Sat & Sun & Holidays)","Twilight Weekend (Sat & Sun & Holiday)"]}]},{"id":214799679497,"title":"Royal Kunia","handle":"royal-kunia-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7007 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b></p>\n<p>Located only 30 minutes from Waikiki high above the Ewa Plains, this Robin Nelson designed course boasts panoramic views of the entire south shore of Oahu. From certain areas throughout the course you're able to see the famous Pearl Harbor Memorial, the city of Honolulu, well-known Diamond Head Monument and the rugged Ko’olau and Waianae Mountain Ranges.</p>\n<p>This par-72 track features generously sized rolling Bermuda fairways, heavily bunkered greens and a generous amount of well-placed lakes. Interestingly, this now extremely popular course sat idle for almost ten years between 1994 and 2003, before finally reopening to an eagerly awaiting cast of golfers.</p>\n<p>Royal Kunia has arguably some of the best par 5's on the island, especially the back to back 9th and 10th holes, that both measure over 600 yards in length from the championship tees. If you are looking for a course that provides great views, has exceptional conditions and a course that is a test for all levels of golfers, this the course for you.</p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Yamagishi</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 2003</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: no </td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 12 pm Special (Mar 13-Apr 13)","After 1 pm Special (Mar 13-Apr 13)"]}]},{"id":213109276681,"title":"Coral Creek Golf Course","handle":"coral-creek-golf-course","body_html":"<b>18 holes, par 72, 6808 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. <br><br></b>Located in Ewa Beach (west of Waikiki), Coral Creek Golf Course provides a challenging test for golfers of all skill levels. The Robin Nelson designed par-72 course weaves its way through exposed natural coral rock formations, resulting in a truly unique golfing experience. The course also offers several water features including a 30 ft. waterfall. It measures just over 6800 yards from the back tees and boasts beautifully manicured Seashore Paspalum Turf.<br><br>Nestled along the Ewa Plain, Coral Creek Golf Course offers one of the most unique and beautiful pieces of land in Oahu. You will be catered to from the moment you enter the property. From bag drop off to country club service, you will find every detail has been taken care of to provide you with the most enjoyable visit. <br><br>The golf course also has a full-service practice facility featuring a full-length driving range with 25 hitting stations, practice putting greens and a chipping area which includes a practice bunker.\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table / Royal Kunia 2 Day","Menehune Challenge","Morning","Twilight 12pm"]}]},{"id":1329932959823,"title":"Hoakalei Country Club","handle":"hoakalei-country-club","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7,413 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p><span>\"Hoakalei Country Club\" is the latest golf course on the island of Oahu, designed by “The Big Easy” himself, Ernie Els, with his vision of hosting PGA events.<br>This highly praised and exciting championship course suits golfers of every caliber, from amateurs to professionals.</span></p>\n<p><span>The 7,413-yard champion course designed by Ernie Els is a challenging course with back tees covering a range of 6,732 yards and regular tees spanning 6,226 yards, as well as generously wide fairways, allowing you to swing your driver with confidence.</span></p>\n<p><span>There are 114 strategically placed bunkers throughout the course, and risk-reward shots are challenging but extremely satisfying. Mr. Els designed this course to suit every golfer, whether amateur or professional, with beautiful water features—some being troublesome. The hole layout has been configured in conjunction with the trade winds, which means Hoakalei is the type of course that could play different from day to day. </span></p>\n<p><span>Hoakalei challenges golfers in their play. With the effect of Oahu’s unique trade winds, reading the ripples of the ponds and striking the ball cleanly down the fairway is a thrill in itself.</span></p>\n<p><span>Enjoy a spectacular time with precious friends and family at a refreshing site integrated with nature. Simple, yet modern, Hoakalei Country Club delivers moments that are “True” against a stunning canvas of “Blue.</span></p>\n<p><span>Hoakalei Country Club is a pleasant combination of beautiful Hawaii and luxurious championship golf.</span></p>\n<p><span>A private country club surrounded by beautiful blue skies and the stunning colors of rich green panoramic views. Spending quality time in this true “paradise” will surely be a delight. The country club features not only a golf course, but a new club house with a swimming pool where you can cool down and relax while reading your favorite book. You can also spend quality time with your family and enjoy the cabanas.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table (10 am - 12 pm)","Mornings (10 am - 12 pm)"]}]},{"id":213113438217,"title":"Ewa Beach Golf Course","handle":"ewa-beach-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6711 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>The Ewa Beach Golf Club is an alluring semi-private golf course tucked away in a forest of Hawaiian Kiawe trees. When you visit Ewa Beach Golf Club you'll be impressed by the strikingly beautiful natural surroundings and incredible course conditions.</p>\n<p>Ewa Beach Golf Club is very popular amongst the locals and features design elements commonly found in Scottish Links golf.<span>  Much like traditional courses in earlier days Ewa has an outward and inward nine rather than a \"front\" and \"back\". </span>Ewa Beach is also one of the only courses on the island that features a massive double green, again, similar to that of the historic Old Course at St. Andrews.</p>\n<p>The course measures just over 6700 yards and boasts narrow tree-lined fairways, water hazards and numerous bunkers. The signature hole at Ewa Beach Golf Club is the beautiful par-3 13th, which requires a skilled tee shot into the wind and over water. </p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td 1pm","Early Morning","Mid-Morning","Blackout"]}]},{"id":1497583124559,"title":"Puakea Special","handle":"puakea-special","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6,954 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><br><br></b>Puakea, designed by golf course Architect Robin Nelson cleverly uses the local natural beauty as his landscape, setting his course at the base of the towering Mount Haupu. Puakea treats golfers to the stunning island beauty that is Kauai, playing through deep ravines, crossing mountain fed streams and revealing views of the Pacific Ocean.<br><br>Robin Nelson had this to say upon completion of his golf course, \"Puakea may be the most fun course to play in Hawaii. The course rides up, down and around deep ravines. It has beautiful, pali views on about three-quarters of the course and ocean views for the rest. Each of the holes are distinctly different so you're constantly facing new, interesting challenges.\"<br><br>Puakea is 7000 yards of exhilarating golf, using beautiful island flora and fauna, giving a sense that it is in complete harmony with nature. The masterfully designed course clearly conveys the routes golfers should take for textbook pars. However, the more daring golfer will be tempted to achieve glorious birdies for a truly rewarding round of golf.</p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table 1","width":800,"height":450}],"options":[{"name":"Title","position":1,"values":["10 am Only Special","Morning","After 11 am"]}]},{"id":1316317331535,"title":"Puakea Golf Course","handle":"puakea-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6,954 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><br><br></b>Puakea, designed by golf course Architect Robin Nelson cleverly uses the local natural beauty as his landscape, setting his course at the base of the towering Mount Haupu. Puakea treats golfers to the stunning island beauty that is Kauai, playing through deep ravines, crossing mountain fed streams and revealing views of the Pacific Ocean.<br><br>Robin Nelson had this to say upon completion of his golf course, \"Puakea may be the most fun course to play in Hawaii. The course rides up, down and around deep ravines. It has beautiful, pali views on about three-quarters of the course and ocean views for the rest. Each of the holes are distinctly different so you're constantly facing new, interesting challenges.\"<br><br>Puakea is 7000 yards of exhilarating golf, using beautiful island flora and fauna, giving a sense that it is in complete harmony with nature. The masterfully designed course clearly conveys the routes golfers should take for textbook pars. However, the more daring golfer will be tempted to achieve glorious birdies for a truly rewarding round of golf.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table [{"name":"Title","position":1,"values":["10 am Only Special","Morning","After 11 am","Blackout","After 2 pm","After 2 pm + Golf Clubs"]}]},{"id":114783866,"title":"Puakea Golf Course ft","handle":"puakea-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6,954 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><br><br></b>Puakea, designed by golf course Architect Robin Nelson cleverly uses the local natural beauty as his landscape, setting his course at the base of the towering Mount Haupu. Puakea treats golfers to the stunning island beauty that is Kauai, playing through deep ravines, crossing mountain fed streams and revealing views of the Pacific Ocean.<br><br>Robin Nelson had this to say upon completion of his golf course, \"Puakea may be the most fun course to play in Hawaii. The course rides up, down and around deep ravines. It has beautiful, pali views on about three-quarters of the course and ocean views for the rest. Each of the holes are distinctly different so you're constantly facing new, interesting challenges.\"<br><br>Puakea is 7000 yards of exhilarating golf, using beautiful island flora and fauna, giving a sense that it is in complete harmony with nature. The masterfully designed course clearly conveys the routes golfers should take for textbook pars. However, the more daring golfer will be tempted to achieve glorious birdies for a truly rewarding round of golf.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 4150 Nuhou Rd - Lihue, Hawaii 96766</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Robin Nelson</td>\n<td>General Manager: <span>Dan Urwiler</span>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1997 (10 Holes), 2003 (18 Holes)</td>\n<td>Head Golf Professional:  <span>Glenn Tamagawa</span>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 holes, par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage:  6954/6471/6061/5225</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: : sprinklers</td>\n<td>Slope:  135/129/123/113</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating:  71.5/71.0/69.2/69.3</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts:  yes</td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Five-somes Policy: after 12:30 11 am","After 2 pm","After 2 pm + Golf Clubs"]}]},{"id":1323205591119,"title":"Kahili Golf Course","handle":"kahili-golf-course","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6554 yards. All prices per person including golf cart rental. </b></p>\n<div>Kahili Golf Course, located at the foothill of the West Maui Mountains, experiences the spectacular bi-coastal views of Mt. Haleakala and the Pacific Ocean.  The 6554 yard par 72 was constructed in 1991 and was designed by Robin Nelson and Rodney Wright. The course is a very popular choice among both visitors and local golfers. Kahili Golf Course plays host to numerous Maui and state-wide tournaments throughout the year. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>This world-class layout offers something for all levels of golfers. The low handicap golfer will appreciate the strong par 5's and lava on the course while the average golfer will enjoy the great par 3's and great course conditions. One thing that stands out about this course is that there are no homes or condos lining the fairways like your typical resort-style course. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>Kahili Golf Course is conveniently located in Waikapu, a mere 10 minutes from Kahului airport and 30 minutes from the Wailea and Ka'anapali Resort Hotels. Kahili Golf Course's great design makes the best of the terrain and Hawaiian trade winds to create a unique golf experience. While you're here, don't forget to play its stunning private sister course King Kamehameha! <br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2500 Honoapiilani Hwy, Wailuku, Hawaii 96793</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Robin Nelson and Rodney Wright</td>\n<td>Director: TJ Figueroa</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: 72, 6554 yards. All prices per person including golf cart rental. </b></p>\n<div>Kahili Golf Course, located at the foothill of the West Maui Mountains, experiences the spectacular bi-coastal views of Mt. Haleakala and the Pacific Ocean.  The 6554 yard par 72 was constructed in 1991 and was designed by Robin Nelson and Rodney Wright. The course is a very popular choice among both visitors and local golfers. Kahili Golf Course plays host to numerous Maui and state-wide tournaments throughout the year. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>This world-class layout offers something for all levels of golfers. The low handicap golfer will appreciate the strong par 5's and lava on the course while the average golfer will enjoy the great par 3's and great course conditions. One thing that stands out about this course is that there are no homes or condos lining the fairways like your typical resort-style course. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>Kahili Golf Course is conveniently located in Waikapu, a mere 10 minutes from Kahului airport and 30 minutes from the Wailea and Ka'anapali Resort Hotels. Kahili Golf Course's great design makes the best of the terrain and Hawaiian trade winds to create a unique golf experience. While you're here, don't forget to play its stunning private sister course King Kamehameha! <br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2500 Honoapiilani Hwy, Wailuku, Hawaii (from Dec 21)","After 12 pm (from Dec 21)","Aeration Special (June 20-July 31)"]}]},{"id":114785912,"title":"Hawaii Kai Golf Course ft","handle":"hawaii-kai-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6614 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><b><br></b></span></b></p>\n<p>Hawaii Kai Golf Course is located in East Honolulu, 13 miles from Waikiki. Golfers find the tropical winds blowing from the ocean not only pleasant but challenging, making the course all the more enjoyable to play.</p>\n<p>Hawaii Kai is the only golf course that can be found on the beautiful eastern coastline of Oahu, and every tee on the course offers a view of the Makapuu Cliffs, luminous Pacific Ocean and the rugged eastern coastline. Wind is a significant factor on the Championship Course, making the otherwise generous fairways a little tougher to hit.</p>\n<p>The Championship Course measures 6614 yards from the back tees and features wide fairways, large greens with well placed bunkers and beautiful views. The coastline along this area of Oahu is probably the most beautiful on the island and just the drive around Koko Head Park is an adventure. In addition to the Championship Course Hawaii Kai also offers a 18-hole 3 par golf course. (NO SINGLE BOOKINGS)</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" 12 pm","Morning Weekend (Sat-Sun) from Jan 1","Morning Weekday (from Jan 1)","After 11:30 am Weekend (Sat-Sun) from Jan 1","After 12 pm Weekday (Mon-Fri) from Jan 1"]}]},{"id":1316510859343,"title":"Kaanapali Royal Course AM SPECIAL","handle":"kaanapali-royal-course-am-special","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<div>\n<b>18 holes, par 71, 6700 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, <strong>range balls (before 1:00 pm).  </strong></b><br><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\">\n<b><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b>The Royal Ka'anapali Course is a Par 71 that stretches to 6700 yards from the championship tees.  The course was opened in 1962 and is one of only two Robert Trent Jones Sr designed courses in all of Hawaii.  The signature hole is the beautiful 5th that takes you directly down to Ka'anapali and Black Rock Beach. (You will be so close to the ocean you can go swimming!)<br><br><span>Robert Trent Jones Sr took</span> advantage of the rolling landscape to create gently sloping fairways and large contoured greens to ensure a challenging approach to each hole. You will have views of the two neighboring islands (Molokai and Lanai) from almost every hole on the course. <br><br>The Royal Ka'anapali Course begins at sea level with a par 5 hole extending 550 yards. The course hugs the shoreline before winding its way to the West Maui Mountain foothills. Legendary Arnold Palmer was quoted as saying that the 18th hole was one of the best and most challenging finishing holes he had ever played. The 449 yard hole plays longer than it looks, hugging the brackish water canal the entire length of the fairway and green, making it a memorable last hole. A local tip that will be sure to aid you while playing this difficult par 4 is that all the putts on this green break towards the island of Lanai.\n<p> </p>\n<a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2290 Kaanapali Parkway, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Robert Trent Jones, Sr. (renovated by Robin Nelson)</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Todd Madden -</td>\n</tr>\n<tr directly on beautiful Kaanapali Beach. Other great holes include the beautiful downhill 9th and the 16th with great views of Kaanapali.<!--Paste code here --></p>\n</div>\n<!--/Reviews-->\n<div id=\"maintenance\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p>The course will not aerate their greens in the next 6 weeks.<!--Paste code here --></p>\n</div>\n<!--/maintenance-->\n<p> </p>\n<ul>\n<li><span style=\"line-height: 1.2;\">Maui Golf</span></li>\n<li><span 11:39 Special","Twilight 1 pm","Morning Special","Twilight Special","Blackout"]}]},{"id":1315847503951,"title":"Kaanapali Royal Course","handle":"kaanapali-royal-golf-course","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<div>\n<b>18 holes, par 71, 6700 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, <strong>range balls (before 1:00 pm).  </strong></b><br><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\">\n<b><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b>The Royal Ka'anapali Course is a Par 71 that stretches to 6700 yards from the championship tees.  The course was opened in 1962 and is one of only two Robert Trent Jones Sr designed courses in all of Hawaii.  The signature hole is the beautiful 5th that takes you directly down to Ka'anapali and Black Rock Beach. (You will be so close to the ocean you can go swimming!)<br><br><span>Robert Trent Jones Sr took</span> advantage of the rolling landscape to create gently sloping fairways and large contoured greens to ensure a challenging approach to each hole. You will have views of the two neighboring islands (Molokai and Lanai) from almost every hole on the course. <br><br>The Royal Ka'anapali Course begins at sea level with a par 5 hole extending 550 yards. The course hugs the shoreline before winding its way to the West Maui Mountain foothills. Legendary Arnold Palmer was quoted as saying that the 18th hole was one of the best and most challenging finishing holes he had ever played. The 449 yard hole plays longer than it looks, hugging the brackish water canal the entire length of the fairway and green, making it a memorable last hole. A local tip that will be sure to aid you while playing this difficult par 4 is that all the putts on this green break towards the island of Lanai.\n<p> </p>\n<a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2290 Kaanapali Parkway, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Robert Trent Jones, Sr. (renovated by Robin Nelson)</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Todd Madden -</td>\n</tr>\n<tr Play after 11 am","Aeration Special (May 10-May17)"]}]},{"id":114784688,"title":"Kaanapali Royal Course ft","handle":"kaanapali-royal-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<div>\n<b>18 holes, par 71, 6700 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, <strong>range balls (before 1:00 pm).  </strong></b><br><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\">\n<b><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b>The Royal Ka'anapali Course is a Par 71 that stretches to 6700 yards from the championship tees.  The course was opened in 1962 and is one of only two Robert Trent Jones Sr designed courses in all of Hawaii.  The signature hole is the beautiful 5th that takes you directly down to Ka'anapali and Black Rock Beach. (You will be so close to the ocean you can go swimming!)<br><br><span>Robert Trent Jones Sr took</span> advantage of the rolling landscape to create gently sloping fairways and large contoured greens to ensure a challenging approach to each hole. You will have views of the two neighboring islands (Molokai and Lanai) from almost every hole on the course. <br><br>The Royal Ka'anapali Course begins at sea level with a par 5 hole extending 550 yards. The course hugs the shoreline before winding its way to the West Maui Mountain foothills. Legendary Arnold Palmer was quoted as saying that the 18th hole was one of the best and most challenging finishing holes he had ever played. The 449 yard hole plays longer than it looks, hugging the brackish water canal the entire length of the fairway and green, making it a memorable last hole. A local tip that will be sure to aid you while playing this difficult par 4 is that all the putts on this green break towards the island of Lanai.\n<p> </p>\n<a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2290 Kaanapali Parkway, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Robert Trent Jones, Sr. (renovated by Robin Nelson)</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Todd Madden -</td>\n</tr>\n<tr 1 pm","Late Twilight after 3pm (until Sept 30)","Late Twilight after 3pm (Oct 1-Nov 30)"]}]},{"id":1316507582543,"title":"Kaanapali Kai Golf Course Specials","handle":"kaanapali-kai-golf-course-realspecial","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><strong>18 holes, par 70, 6388 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls (before 1:00pm). </strong>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\">Ka'anapali Kai Course was originally designed by architect Arthur Jack Snyder in 1976, but was recently renovated by one of Hawaii's most prolific golf course architects Robin Nelson. At 6400 yards, the Par 70 course is now more forgiving and features subtle, undulating greens that suits all levels of play. The newly designed course even made headlines when chosen in 2008 to host the Ladies Only<em> Big Break Ka'anapali.</em><br><br>Additional features that make the course enjoyable include natural canals, trenches and lava rock boundaries which lie along many of the holes. The course is also beautifully landscaped with native flowers such as the Hawaii state flower Hibiscus, Bougainvillea and wonderfully smelling Plumeria, not to mention the prevalent Norfolk Pines and Coconut Trees that border many fairways. <br><br>With sweeping views of the West Maui Coast and neighbor islands Molokai and Lanai, the Kaanapali Kai Course is unquestionably one of the top courses on the island. To add to these great views if playing here between November and April you may even be lucky enough to spot humpback whales cavorting offshore.\n<p> </p>\n<a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course 11:34 Special","Blackout","Morning Special"]}]},{"id":1315844030543,"title":"Kaanapali Kai Golf Course","handle":"kaanapali-kai-golf-course","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><strong>18 holes, par 70, 6388 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls (before 1:00pm). </strong>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\">Ka'anapali Kai Course was originally designed by architect Arthur Jack Snyder in 1976, but was recently renovated by one of Hawaii's most prolific golf course architects Robin Nelson. At 6400 yards, the Par 70 course is now more forgiving and features subtle, undulating greens that suits all levels of play. The newly designed course even made headlines when chosen in 2008 to host the Ladies Only<em> Big Break Ka'anapali.</em><br><br>Additional features that make the course enjoyable include natural canals, trenches and lava rock boundaries which lie along many of the holes. The course is also beautifully landscaped with native flowers such as the Hawaii state flower Hibiscus, Bougainvillea and wonderfully smelling Plumeria, not to mention the prevalent Norfolk Pines and Coconut Trees that border many fairways. <br><br>With sweeping views of the West Maui Coast and neighbor islands Molokai and Lanai, the Kaanapali Kai Course is unquestionably one of the top courses on the island. To add to these great views if playing here between November and April you may even be lucky enough to spot humpback whales cavorting offshore.\n<p> </p>\n<a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2290 Kaanapali Parkway, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761</td>\n</tr>\n<tr am","Aeration Special (Apr13 - Apr19)"]}]},{"id":114784620,"title":"Kaanapali Kai Golf Course ft","handle":"kaanapali-kai-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><strong>18 holes, par 70, 6388 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls (before 1:00pm). </strong>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"><strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></strong></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\">Ka'anapali Kai Course was originally designed by architect Arthur Jack Snyder in 1976, but was recently renovated by one of Hawaii's most prolific golf course architects Robin Nelson. At 6400 yards, the Par 70 course is now more forgiving and features subtle, undulating greens that suits all levels of play. The newly designed course even made headlines when chosen in 2008 to host the Ladies Only<em> Big Break Ka'anapali.</em><br><br>Additional features that make the course enjoyable include natural canals, trenches and lava rock boundaries which lie along many of the holes. The course is also beautifully landscaped with native flowers such as the Hawaii state flower Hibiscus, Bougainvillea and wonderfully smelling Plumeria, not to mention the prevalent Norfolk Pines and Coconut Trees that border many fairways. <br><br>With sweeping views of the West Maui Coast and neighbor islands Molokai and Lanai, the Kaanapali Kai Course is unquestionably one of the top courses on the island. To add to these great views if playing here between November and April you may even be lucky enough to spot humpback whales cavorting offshore.\n<p> </p>\n<a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2290 Kaanapali Parkway, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Arthur Jack Snyder (renovated by Robin Nelson)</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Todd Madden - Dir. of Operations</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1976</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Sutee Nitakorn</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 holes, par 70</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6388/6010/5563/4522</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinklers &amp; 150 yards</td>\n<td>Slope: 135/130/126/109</td>\n</tr>\n<tr 1 pm","Late Twilight (after 3pm)"]}]},{"id":169301132,"title":"Kapalua Plantation","handle":"kapalua-plantation-golf-club","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 73, 7411 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range ball and bottled water.</b></p>\n<p><span>The Plantation Course at Kapalua is the host of the PGA TOUR Sentry Tournament of Champions each January, which features an elite field of the previous years PGA TOUR winners. Kapalua Plantation is so renowned that now for the 10th straight year in a row it has been named the Top Golf Course in Hawaii by <em>GoflWeek Magazine</em>.</span></p>\n<p><span>The Plantation Course was designed by famed golf architects Ben Crenshaw and Bill Coore and stretches out across natural geographic formations and pineapple plantation fields. The views are simply incredible from every hole on the course. The par 73, 7411-yard course has also hosted many of golf’s greats. Previous competitors include Tiger Woods, Ernie Els, Bubba Watson, Jim Furyk and many more. Congratulations to this years 2019 winner Xander Schauffele who won with a score or 269 (23<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> under par</span>). </span></p>\n<p><span>Built around the beauty of the West Maui Mountains, the Plantation Course at Kapalua ranks among the world’s greatest golf courses. Witness awe-inspiring views and dramatic elevation changes as you test your ability and experience golf at its finest.  </span></p>\n<p>The finishing 17th and 18th holes are truly two of the great finishing holes in golf.  The 17th being a 508 yard par 4 and the 18th a 663 yard par 5! Not to worry though, each hole has serious elevation changes and drives can easily be found over 400 yards down the fairway!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<br> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2000 Plantation Club Dr., Kapalua, Hawaii 96761</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Ben Crenshaw</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Alex Nakajima</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1991</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Zack Peck</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 73</td>\n<td>Yardage:
