Bay","handle":"kapalua-bay-golf-club","body_html":"<div class=\"tabdiv\" id=\"course\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6600 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. </b></p>\nExperience golf at its finest at the Kapalua Resort. The Bay Course, host of the 2008 Kapalua LPGA Classic and former host to the Lincoln-Mercury Kapalua International, winds its way through towering palms and flowering hibiscus. <br><br>Built with the tee on one side of a Pacific inlet and the green on the other, Hawaii's trade winds will be sure to help your 5th tee shot carry over glistening Oneloa Bay. With its uninterrupted views of the Pacific and gentle rolling fairways, the Bay Course is sure to excite golfers of all skill levels.<br><br>The Arnold Palmer and Francis Duane designed course was one of the earliest features in the development of Kapalua Resort and the forerunner of the resorts two championship courses. Recognized as one of the top golf resorts in the world, there is no better place to experience golf than at legendary Kapalua!<br><a name=\"details\"></a><br><br>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" ft","handle":"hawaii-prince-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>27 holes A/B/C, par 72, 7117-7255 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span color=\"#ff0000\" style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> (If you need transportation, we require 24 hours notice).</span></b></p>\n<p>Designed by Arnold Palmer and Ed Seay, this unique course is the only one in Hawaii to feature 27 holes. It occupies 270 acres of sheer beauty and offers stunning views of the rain-carved Waianae Mountains.</p>\n<p>Hawaii Prince is located about 35 minutes from Waikiki on the Ewa Plains. Each of the 9’s are designated \"A\", \"B\" and \"C\", and the abundant number of water features is the dominant characteristic of this track.  Within the property of the golf course there are 10 lakes which come in to play in over half of the holes. </p>\n<p>In addition to its 27 holes the Hawaii Prince Golf Club sports an excellent practice facility and features a full service clubhouse with a terrific restaurant.  Hawaii Tee Times also offers 2 round trip transportation package specials daily to the course.</p>\n<p><strong>Transport Packages Info</strong></p>\n<p><span>The Hawaii Prince Golf Club picks up from seven hotel locations in Waikiki: Waikiki Beach Marriott, Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, Halekulani Hotel, Trolley Bus Stop (located in front of Trump Tower Waikiki), Sheraton Waikiki, Grand Islander by Hilton Vacations and the Hawaii Prince Hotel. Two shuttles are available per day. One picks up between 6:30 a.m. - 7:00 a.m. and the second shuttle picks up between 10:00 a.m. - 10:30 a.m. Single players are eligible for the transport package with Hawaii Prince. Guests will be dropped back at the same hotel location after the round. Tee times are approximately 90 minutes after the pick up time. Transport packages must be booked at least 24 hours in advance.</span></p>\n<p>For the Early shuttle - Select tee times between 8:04 a.m. - 8:44 a.m.<br>For the Later shuttle - Select tee times between 11:32 a.m. - 12:12 p.m.</p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" Rentals"]}]},{"id":3277122629,"title":"The Dunes FT","handle":"the-dunes-at-maui-lani-ft","body_html":"<div><b>18 holes, par 72, 6841 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> <br></span></b></div>\n<div>The Dunes at Maui Lani Golf Course is built on million-year old sand dunes located in central Maui. Architect Robin Nelson loved this natural setting so much that he left the topography of the unspoiled dunes terrain alone when crafting this links-style course. The Dunes plays 6841 yards from the Black Tees and has a USGA Slope Rating of 141.  </div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Dunes at Maui Lani is designed much like the courses in the British Isles that were built centuries ago, as its holes take full advantage of Maui’s sloping island dune terrain. Each of the 18 holes are unique compared to anything else found in America because of the terrain upon which they are set and therefore make this course one-of-a-kind to play.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div>In addition to the incomparable course itself you will find that The Dunes has the only lit range with grass tees in all of central Maui, making it a great place to practice after hours as well. </div>\n<div></div>\n<p><br> <a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" Dec 5"]}]},{"id":262959109,"title":"Poipu Bay GC","handle":"poipu-bay-gc","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><a href=\"#details\">Course Details</a> | <a href=\"#scorecard\">Scorecard</a> | <a href=\"#layout\">Layout</a><!--Paste code here --></p>\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7123 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></b></p>\n<div>Poipu Bay Resort Golf Course was the home of the PGA Grand Slam of Golf from 1994 – 2006.  The course has won numerous awards and has been consistently rated among the top golf courses in Hawaii and the U.S. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>This outstanding course is backed by lush emerald mountains and sculpted from a rolling plateau eight stories above the Pacific Ocean. Nestled among the gentle contours of Poipu Bay you’ll discover the remains of Hawaiian heiau (places of worship) and ancient stone walls. If this weren't challenge enough, Mother Nature presents you with one distraction after another. This golf course is breathtaking but don't let your mind wander to the beautiful ocean views and beach vistas or this undulating golf course will eat you alive.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>You might see rare Hawaiian monk seals and native nene geese and also green sea turtles and humpback whales, you’ll have lots of good excuses to back your scorecard. Even the most focused golfer will be challenged by the breathtaking views.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>This links style layout designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr. can play over 7,000 yards long. The ocean comes into play on holes 15-17, a beautiful venue for golfers of all abilities. A unique and unforgettable golf experience awaits you.</div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<p> </p>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" 12 pm","Princeville Makai/Poipu 2 day"]}]},{"id":5776383173,"title":"Hokuala Special","handle":"copy-of-hokuala-kauai-lagoons-special","body_html":"<p>18<b> holes, par 72, 7156 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span></b></p>\n<p>Hokuala (Formerly known as Kauai Lagoons) is a lush, 750-acre resort carefully secluded in the southwest corner of the island of Kauai in Hawaii. Fairways weave through mango and guava tree forests, along imposing ocean cliffs and over promontories high above the harbor, and among some forty acres of fresh water lagoons that wind their way throughout the resort.<br><br>It is said that when legendary golfer and architect Jack Nicklaus created the original Kiele Course in the late 1980's, the terrain lent itself so well to his vision that he made but a single change to his original design. In 2011, Jack Nicklaus was again called upon. This time to redesign the back nine of his famed Kiele course. Included are all new greens, new white silica sand bunkers, and three new holes. One is a new ocean hole that is now the centerpiece of what is the longest stretch of continuous ocean holes of any course in Hawaii. Four fabulous holes providing over 1/2 mile of unobstructed oceanfront.</p>\n<p>  </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 3351 Hoolaulea Way - Lihue, Hawaii 96766</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Jack Nicklaus</td>\n<td>Director of Golf:  Fran Roach</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1988</td>\n<td>Golf Professional:  Kellie Hines</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course 18 holes, par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage:  7156/6722/6277/5377</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: : sprinklers</td>\n<td>Slope:  142/134/130</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating:  76.2/73.5/71.6/67.5</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts: yes </td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Five-somes Policy: no</td>\n<td>Walking: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Greens:  TifEagle greens</td>\n<td>Fairways: Fee Please Enter Number of Golfers"]}]},{"id":8232750537,"title":"Mililani Golf Club ft","handle":"mililani-golf-club-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6455 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b></p>\n<p><span>Nestled on a plateau, with the Waianae Mountains and the Ko'olau Mountains stretching away in the distance, Mililani Golf Club provides a \"get away from it all\" feeling of remoteness.  The Bob Baldock design features Norfolk Pines, Eucalyptus trees, African Tulip trees, and lush tropical Hawaiian foliage, in bloom all year round.</span><span>   </span><br><br><span>Mililani Golf Club offers a driving range, chipping green, and two putting greens conveniently located near the clubhouse.</span><span>   </span><span>Just a short 30-minute drive from Waikiki located in the quiet community of Mililani, which means \"beloved heaven\" in Hawaiian.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table {"products":[{"id":5753392197,"title":"Kona CC Ocean Course Special","handle":"kona-cc-ocean-course-special","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6613 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span color=\"#ff0000\">(Greens aerating September 10)</span></span><br> </b></p>\n<p>The William Bell designed Ocean Course was built in 1966, and maintains its charm by incorporating natural settings along the Pacific Ocean.  Being so close to the ocean you may get sprayed by the ocean mist on picturesque signature holes #3 and #12 as well as hole #13. Enjoy seeing the grand splash on hole #13 where you will see the blow hole known as the “Puka” in Hawaiian.</p>\n<p>Keep a lookout for Humpback whales during November through March.This 18 hole championship course offers wide, lush fairways, Bermuda grass greens and numerous sand traps. The only natural obstacles are the turquoise blue water and lava rocks.</p>\n<p>You'll know why this course was chosen as one of the top 100 courses by Golf Digest. Golf for Women magazine, ESPN, and ZAGAT Guide recognizes this course as one of nation's top golf facilities and it also has a rating of \"excellent\" as voted by players in America's top golf courses.</p>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. <br> </b></p>\n<p>The William Bell designed Ocean Course was built in 1966, and maintains its charm by incorporating natural settings along the Pacific Ocean and gorgeous mountain views. Being so close to the ocean you may even get sprayed by the ocean mist on picturesque ocean signature holes #3, #12 and #13. Enjoy seeing the grand splash on hole #13 where you will see the impressive blow hole known as “puka” in Hawaiian.</p>\n<p>Keep a lookout for Humpback Whales during November through March. This 18 hole championship course offers wide, lush fairways, Bermuda Grass greens and numerous sand bunkers. The only natural obstacles are the turquoise blue water and lava rocks.</p>\n<p>You'll know why this course was chosen as one of the top 100 courses by <em>Golf Digest.</em> <em>Golf for Women Magazine</em>, <em>ESPN</em> and <em>ZAGAT Guide</em> also has recognized Kona Ocean Country Club as one of nation's top golf facilities and it maintains an \"excellent\" rating by players of America's top golf courses.</p>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span></b></p>\n<p>Waikele Country Club is only 30 minutes west of Waikiki. The beautiful par  72 Ted Robinson designed course is an impeccably manicured track that provides challenges and enjoyment to players of all skill levels.</p>\n<p>The course boasts spectacular views of Diamond Head, Pearl Harbor, and the Ko'olau and Waianae mountains. Waikele features rolling fairways, undulating Tiff Eagle greens, strategically placed bunkers, and a generous compliment of water features.</p>\n<p><span>A truly comprehensive country club, Waikele Country Club features a golf shop with the finest names in equipment and apparel, locker rooms, a restaurant, and a full-service driving range, and putting areas.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details </h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" Special","handle":"kaanapali-kai-golf-course-special","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<div><b>18 holes, par 70, 6388 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b></div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>Ka'anapali Kai Course redesigned by architect Arthur Jack Snyder in 1976, was recently renovated by Hawaii's most prolific golf course architect, Robin Nelson. At 6,400 yards, the Par 70 course is a more forgiving golf course with subtle, undulating greens that suits all levels of play and in 2008 hosted the 12 ladies of T.V's Big Break Ka'anapali.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>Features that make the course most enjoyable include natural canals, gulches and lava rock boundaries. The course is landscaped with indigenous flowers along the trails like the hibiscus, bougainvillea and plumeria, as well as the Norfolk Pines and coconut trees that border many fairways. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>With sweeping views of the West Maui coast, the neighbor islands of Molokai and Lanai, the views are spectacular and in the winter you may see humpback whales cavorting offshore.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td 1 pm","Triple Play Challenge"]}]},{"id":141541829,"title":"Kaanapali Royal Special","handle":"kaanapali-royal-daily-special","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<div></div>\n<p><b style=\"line-height: 1.5;\">18 holes, par 71, 6700 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b></p>\n<div>The Royal Ka'anapali Course, Par 71, 6,700 yards opened its lush fairways in 1962 and is typically a Robert Trent Jones Sr course – One of only two designed by him in Hawaii. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>Taking advantage of the rolling landscape to create gently sloping fairways and large contoured greens to ensure a challenging approach to each hole, Robert Trent Jones Sr created a challenging course which requires careful club selection and putting skills.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>\n<br>The Royal Ka'anapali Course begins at sea level with a par 5 hole extending 550 yards. The course hugs the shoreline before winding its way to the West Maui Mountain foothills. Arnold Palmer was quoted as saying that the 18th hole (par 4) was one of the best and most challenging finishing holes he had ever played. The 449 yard hole plays longer than it looks, hugging the brackish water canal the entire length of the fairway and green, making it a memorable last hole.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Nelson)</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Todd Madden - Dir. of Operations</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1962</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Sutee Nitakorn</td>\n</tr>\n<tr  (After 1 pm)","Triple Play Challenge"]}]},{"id":1316313464911,"title":"Princeville Makai","handle":"princeville-makai-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7,233 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.</b><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span color=\"#ff0000\" style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><b> </b></span></span></p>\n<p><br>The Makai Golf Course in Princeville re-opened in January 2010 after a multi-million dollar renovation that reconfigured two 9 hole courses into one beautiful 18 hole course. Improvements include newly reshaped bunkers, two large practice tees and a expanded practice putting green, not to mention all of tee boxes replaced with Seashore Paspalum, a drought resistant grass that is so smooth it feels as if you're putting on carpet.<br><br>One of the 7223 yard par 72 Makai Course’s signature holes include the challenging Par 3 third, where the tee is about 100 feet above a protected green. Other recognized holes include 7, 13 and 18, where there is an abundance of scenic views of towering mountains, Bali Hai and world-famous Hanalei Bay. Just looking down at the breaking surf below the cliffs will be sure to provide you with an experience you’ll never forget.<br><br>Additional non golf course related features of Makai is a newly built, <span>award-winning golf shop which possesses clubs, clothing items and more. The </span>clubhouse also has a large lanai area where the Makai Grill is located, a perfect spot to relax after an enjoyable day of golf.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Makai/Poipu 2 day","Kauai Golf Challenge","Blackout","Morning"]}]},{"id":114783800,"title":"Princeville Makai ft","handle":"princeville-makai-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7,233 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.</b><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span color=\"#ff0000\" style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><b> </b></span></span></p>\n<p><br>The Makai Golf Course in Princeville re-opened in January 2010 after a multi-million dollar renovation that reconfigured two 9 hole courses into one beautiful 18 hole course. Improvements include newly reshaped bunkers, two large practice tees and a expanded practice putting green, not to mention all of tee boxes replaced with Seashore Paspalum, a drought resistant grass that is so smooth it feels as if you're putting on carpet.<br><br>One of the 7223 yard par 72 Makai Course’s signature holes include the challenging Par 3 third, where the tee is about 100 feet above a protected green. Other recognized holes include 7, 13 and 18, where there is an abundance of scenic views of towering mountains, Bali Hai and world-famous Hanalei Bay. Just looking down at the breaking surf below the cliffs will be sure to provide you with an experience you’ll never forget.<br><br>Additional non golf course related features of Makai is a newly built, <span>award-winning golf shop which possesses clubs, clothing items and more. The </span>clubhouse also has a large lanai area where the Makai Grill is located, a perfect spot to relax after an enjoyable day of golf.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Only","Ferry & Lanai Shuttle"]}]},{"id":401960024,"title":"Ko Olina Golf Club 2","handle":"ko-olina-golf-club-2","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6867 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\">(If you need transportation, we require 24 hours notice). </span></span><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p><b> </b>Located on the west coast of the island at the Ko Olina Resort, the Ted Robinson designed Ko Olina Golf Club is one of the few resort courses located on Oahu.<span>  </span>The par-72 layout features generous landing areas, multi-tiered greens, cascading waterfalls and a picturesque ocean location. From the back tees Ko Olina measures 6,867 yards and is superbly maintained, with wide fairways and well-bunkered, multi-tiered greens.</p>\n<p>The 170-acre), par-72 golf course opened in January 1990, hosting the LPGA Tour's Hawaiian Ladies Open from 1990 to 1995, the Senior PGA Tour's Ko Olina Senior Invitational in 1992 and the Fields Open in Hawaii from 2006 to 2008. Women's professional golf returned in April 2012 with the inaugural LPGA Lotte Championship, won by Ai Miyazato. This year's winner (2015) was Kim Sei-Young.</p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" Golf Clubs"]}]},{"id":371107816,"title":"Royal Hawaiian (Aloha)","handle":"royal-hawaiian-aloha","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><a href=\"#details\">Course Details</a> | <a href=\"#scorecard\">Scorecard</a> | <a href=\"#layout\">Layout</a></p>\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6595 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\">﻿</span><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Formerly known as Luana Hills, Royal Hawaiian is located on the east side of Oahu at the base of the Ko' olau mountain range with Mt. Olomana in the background.<span>  </span>The course is carved through a tropical rain forest and has beautiful views throughout.</p>\n<p>Royal Hawaiian Golf Course is best described as playing golf in Jurassic Park without the dinosaurs!  It all starts from the 1.5 mile drive through the magnificent rain forest to the clubhouse. You won't find a more beautiful drive to a golf course anywhere.  When you finally arrive at the course you will be amazed that a golf course could be built in such paradise.</p>\n<p>The Pete and Perry Dye designed layout has contrasting nines, with a front side that features a rugged mountainous terrain and back nine a more open rolling terrain With a slope of 138 from the back tees and a distance of about 6,600 yards, this demanding track is an interesting mix of beauty and challenge.</p>\n<p>There are simply too many signature holes on this course to describe, playing Royal Hawaiian should be on everyone's bucket list.</p>\n<b> </b> <!--Paste code here --> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<p> </p>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 770 Auloa Road Kailua Oahu, Hawaii 96734</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Pete/Perry Dye</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Darin Sumimoto</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1994</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Marc Mellor</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 holes, par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6513/6124/5569/4393</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope: 138/132/128/117/101</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating: 73.1/71.5/67.7/65.2/62.1</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts:  yes</td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Five-somes Policy: some exceptions</td>\n<td>Walking: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Challenge"]}]},{"id":371107244,"title":"Hawaii Kai (Aloha)","handle":"hawaii-kai-aloha","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><a href=\"#details\">Course Details</a> | <a href=\"#scorecard\">Scorecard</a> | <a href=\"#layout\">Layout</a></p>\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6614 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><b><br></b></span></b></p>\n<p>Hawaii Kai Golf Course is located in East Honolulu, 13 miles from Waikiki. While golfing, the Pacific Ocean can be seen from every hole. Golfers, find the tropical winds blowing from the ocean not only pleasant but challenging, making the course enjoyable to play.</p>\n<p>Hawaii Kai is the only golf course found on the beautiful eastern coastline of Oahu, and every tee on the course offers a view of the Makapuu Cliffs, Pacific Ocean and the rugged eastern Oahu coastline. Wind is a significant factor on the Championship Course, making the otherwise generous fairways a little tougher to hit.</p>\n<p>The Championship Course measures 6614 yards from the championship tee's and features wide fairways, large greens with well placed bunkers, and beautiful views. The coastline along this area of Oahu is probably the most beautiful on the island, and just the drive around Koko Head Park is an adventure. Even more fun is a round of golf on this challenging course, whether played from the regular or championship tees. The course is always in excellent condition. In addition to the Championship Course, Hawaii Kai also offers a 9-hole executive course.</p>\n <!--Paste code here --> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<p> </p>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 8902 Kalanianaole Hwy - Honolulu, Hawaii 96825</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: William Bell</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Mike Hickey - pro shop mgr. </td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: 150 yard hibiscus tree</td>\n<td>Slope: 123 /120 /123</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating: 71.4/69.8/71.9</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts:  yes</td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Five-somes Policy: yes</td>\n<td>Walking: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr soft spike only</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>GPS Tracking: no</td>\n<td>Lessons: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Club House: Challenge"]}]},{"id":371099212,"title":"Royal Kunia (Oahu Challenge)","handle":"royal-kunia-oahu-challenge","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7007 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span></b></p>\n<p>Located 30 minutes from Waikiki high above the Ewa plains, This Robin Nelson designed courses boasts panoramic views of the entire south shore of Oahu including Pearl Harbor, the city of Honolulu, Diamond Head, and the Ko’olau and Waianae mountain ranges.</p>\n<p>This par-72 track features generously sized rolling Bermuda fairways, heavily bunkered greens, and a compliment of lakes of palms.<span>  </span>Interestingly, this course sat idle for almost ten years between 1994 and 2003, before finally opening to an eagerly awaiting cast of golfers.</p>\n<p>Royal Kunia has some of the best par 5's on the island especially the back to back 9th and 10th holes, where both holes are over 600 yards from the back tees. If you are looking for golf course that provides great views, exceptional conditions and a course that provides a test for all levels of golfers, this is a very good course to play.</p>\n<b> </b> <!--Paste code here --> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr Island Challenge"]}]},{"id":371098832,"title":"Ko'olau (Oahu Challenge)","handle":"koolau-oahu-challenge","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><a href=\"#details\">Course Details</a> | <a href=\"#scorecard\">Scorecard</a> | <a href=\"#layout\">Layout</a></p>\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7310 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rentals. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Carved out of a magnificent tropical forest, Ko'olau Golf Club is one of the most inspiring golf experiences you will play anywhere in the world. Ko'olau is nestled below Oahu's historic and popular Pali Lookout. The course offers breathtaking views of the majestic 2,000-foot-high cliffs of the Ko'olau Mountain Range, cascading waterfalls and commanding views of the Pacific Ocean and the beautiful windward side of Oahu.</p>\n<p>Ko'olau's natural setting provided master golf course architect Dick Nugent the opportunity to create a gem of a golf course that encompasses over 280 acres of spectacular terrain with a scenic 7,310-yard, par-72 layout unlike any other in the world.<span>  </span></p>\n<p>Considered by many the toughest golf course on the planet, Ko'olau was originally pegged with a slope of 162 from the back tees but later dropped to 152 which is just three points shy of the maximum value acknowledged in the slope rating system.</p>\n<p>Ko'olau features some of the most extraordinary scenery in the world.Ko'olau can commonly be found in the top golf course lists created by Golf Magazine and other trusted names in golf.</p>\n <!--Paste code here --> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<p> </p>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Kamehameha","handle":"king-kamehameha-golf-club","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6875 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and range balls. </b></p>\n<p><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><b>﻿(As of December 21, 2016 until further notice, King Kamehameha will be Private.)</b></span></p>\n<p>The King Kamehameha Golf Club is the only private 18-hole golf course in Maui, Hawaii. The club's 74,000 sq. ft. clubhouse is designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and sits 750 feet above sea level, offering outstanding views of Haleakala and bi-coastal ocean views. The Ted Robinson designed course was named to honor the greatest king in the history of the Hawaiian Islands.<br><br>The King Kamehameha Golf Club will test each club in your arsenal. Enjoy a pure golf experience with no surrounding homes or traffic to break your concentration. According to the Robinson philosophy, the golfer attacks and the designer defends. The overriding objective of good course design being a balance of these extremes, creating an effective and rewarding experience for golfers at all levels of play.</p>\n<p>Playing a round at \"King Kam\", as the locals call it, is a treat that should not be missed. Since it is a private course, there will be very few golfers to affect the pace of play. Additionally, the course conditions are always outstanding with manicured fairways and fast, smooth greens. <br><br></p>\n<a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 2500 Honoapiilani Highway Wailuku, Maui, Hawaii 96793</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Ted Robinson Sr/Jr</td>\n<td>Director of Golf:  Rick Catillo</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1991</td>\n<td>General Manager: Scott Carroll</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 holes, par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage:  7060/6584/6110/5254</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: : sprinklers</td>\n<td>Slope:  139/132/129/124</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating:  75.9/73.2/71.5/67.1</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts: yes </td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Five-somes Policy: </td>\n<td>Walking: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr unavailable","position":1,"values":["Currently Unavailable"]}]},{"id":1316319658063,"title":"Pukalani Country Club","handle":"pukalani-golf-course","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6,882 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.</b></p>\nThe Pukalani Country Club is located at the 1,100 foot elevation level, resulting in cooler playing conditions. It is up the side of world famous Mount Haleakala, an extinct volcano whose name in Hawaiian translates to \"House of the Rising Sun\".</div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\">Pukalani Country Club in \"Up-Country\" Maui overlooks the Pacific Ocean and offers stunning panoramic views of the entire island. With wide and hilly fairways, and greens which are fast and sloped, the biggest challenges come from the wind and elevation changes. The terrain has nice, gentle curves, slopes and hills.<br><br>Pukalani's 18 holes were designed by renowned golf course architect Bob Baldock who has designed over 69 golf courses public and private alike throughout the United States.<br><br><br> <a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 360 Pukalani Street, Pukalani, HI 96768.</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Bob Baldock</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Ron Huffman</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1980</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: n/a</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6882/6443/5579</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope: 127/121/123</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating: 72.9/70.9/71.4</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts:  yes</td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: {"products":[{"id":114785582,"title":"Pukalani Country Club ft","handle":"pukalani-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6,882 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b></p>\nThe Pukalani Country Club is located at the 1,100 foot elevation level, resulting in cooler playing conditions. It is up the side of world famous Mount Haleakala, an extinct volcano whose name in Hawaiian translates to \"House of the Rising Sun\".</div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\"></div>\n<div class=\"tabdiv\">Pukalani Country Club in \"Up-Country\" Maui overlooks the Pacific Ocean and offers stunning panoramic views of the entire island. With wide and hilly fairways, and greens which are fast and sloped, the biggest challenges come from the wind and elevation changes. The terrain has nice, gentle curves, slopes and hills.<br><br>Pukalani's 18 holes were designed by renowned golf course architect Bob Baldock who has designed over 69 golf courses public and private alike throughout the United States.<br><br><br> <a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 360 Pukalani Street, Pukalani, HI 96768</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6882/6443/5579</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope: 127/121/123</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating: 72.9/70.9/71.4</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts:  yes</td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Golf Clubs"]}]},{"id":1315842883663,"title":"Hapuna Golf Course","handle":"hapuna-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6875 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span><br><br></b>Hapuna Golf Course offers spectacular views of the Kohala Coast and the Pacific Ocean while majestic Mauna Kea, Mauna Loa, and Kohala Mountains form the backdrop. With its seemingly endless views and dramatic elevation changes beginning at sea level and rising to 700 feet, Hapuna Golf Course nestles into the rugged desert terrain above the west shore of Hawaii's Big Island. <br><br>This Arnold Palmer / Ed Seay designed course is a championship links-style design that was built in 1992 and stretches to just under 6900 yards. Its challenging play and environmental sensitivity make it one of Hawaii's most unique golf courses. The Pacific Ocean serves as the picture perfect backdrop and can be seen from every hole. Teeing off at just under 700 feet of elevation, the signature par-4 12th hole provides one of the most spectacular panoramic views on the Big Island, where the island of Maui is visible in the distance. Hapuna Golf Course is also favored among locals and therefore has gained a reputation as one of Big Island's hidden gems.  </p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Silliman</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1992</td>\n<td>Golf Professional:  Duane Otte</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 AM (May 15-May 28)","Aeration Special after 1 pm (May 15-May 28)"]}]},{"id":114780738,"title":"Hapuna Golf Course ft","handle":"hapuna-golf-course-2","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6875 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span><br><br></b>Hapuna Golf Course offers spectacular views of the Kohala Coast and the Pacific Ocean while majestic Mauna Kea, Mauna Loa, and Kohala Mountains form the backdrop. With its seemingly endless views and dramatic elevation changes beginning at sea level and rising to 700 feet, Hapuna Golf Course nestles into the rugged desert terrain above the west shore of Hawaii's Big Island. <br><br>This Arnold Palmer / Ed Seay designed course is a championship links-style design that was built in 1992 and stretches to just under 6900 yards. Its challenging play and environmental sensitivity make it one of Hawaii's most unique golf courses. The Pacific Ocean serves as the picture perfect backdrop and can be seen from every hole. Teeing off at just under 700 feet of elevation, the signature par-4 12th hole provides one of the most spectacular panoramic views on the Big Island, where the island of Maui is visible in the distance. Hapuna Golf Course is also favored among locals and therefore has gained a reputation as one of Big Island's hidden gems.  </p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td 11 am","After 1 pm","Morning (from Apr 1)","After 11 am (from Apr 1)","After 1 pm (from Apr 1)"]}]},{"id":1316305895503,"title":"Mauna Kea","handle":"mauna-kea-golf-course","body_html":"<p><strong><span style=\"color: #000000;\"></span></strong><strong><span style=\"color: #000000;\"></span></strong><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><strong></strong></span>18<b> holes, par 72, 7370 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <br> </b></p>\n<div>The multi-award winning Mauna Kea Golf Course has led the way in standards of course beauty and design since 1964, solidifying its place in Hawaii's history as one of the most scenic and favored golf courses. Designed by Robert Trent Jones Sr., the 18-hole championship course presents dramatic changes in elevation, large undulating greens and 120 well-placed bunkers. The spectacular signature hole is the famous third, where surging inlet water races to meet the rocky shoreline, affording one of the most dramatic and breathtaking views of any course today.<br><br>Without changing the essential character of his father's design, Rees Jones Inc. re-planted the championship course with highly efficient ultra-dwarf Tifeagle Bermudagrass on the greens and Tifway 419 hybrid Bermudagrass on the tees, fairways and roughs. State-of-the-art irrigation systems, liners in the bunkers and advance drainage improvements keep the golf course in top shape and even save on environmental resources.<br><br>Mauna Kea includes world-class practice facilities to elevate your game while enjoying epic vistas of the Kohala Coast's rolling waves, panoramic views of the sea and land, snow-capped Mauna Kea Volcano, rugged lava beds and the sparkling blue Pacific. Golfers can also gather together at the new Number 3 Restaurant after golf to relax in a casual atmosphere. You will definitely want to order some pupus and a nice cold one from the tap, or maybe try the signature Mauna Kea cocktail, to toast to having played a round at such an amazingly beautiful course. </div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr ft","handle":"mauna-kea-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span>18<b> holes, par 72, 7370 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <br> </b></p>\n<div>The multi-award winning Mauna Kea Golf Course has led the way in standards of course beauty and design since 1964, solidifying its place in Hawaii's history as one of the most scenic and favored golf courses. Designed by Robert Trent Jones Sr., the 18-hole championship course presents dramatic changes in elevation, large undulating greens and 120 well-placed bunkers. The spectacular signature hole is the famous third, where surging inlet water races to meet the rocky shoreline, affording one of the most dramatic and breathtaking views of any course today.<br><br>Without changing the essential character of his father's design, Rees Jones Inc. re-planted the championship course with highly efficient ultra-dwarf Tifeagle Bermudagrass on the greens and Tifway 419 hybrid Bermudagrass on the tees, fairways and roughs. State-of-the-art irrigation systems, liners in the bunkers and advance drainage improvements keep the golf course in top shape and even save on environmental resources.<br><br>Mauna Kea includes world-class practice facilities to elevate your game while enjoying epic vistas of the Kohala Coast's rolling waves, panoramic views of the sea and land, snow-capped Mauna Kea Volcano, rugged lava beds and the sparkling blue Pacific. Golfers can also gather together at the new Number 3 Restaurant after golf to relax in a casual atmosphere. You will definitely want to order some pupus and a nice cold one from the tap, or maybe try the signature Mauna Kea cocktail, to toast to having played a round at such an amazingly beautiful course.</div>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Josh Silliman</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1964</td>\n<td>Golf Professional:  <span>Duane Otte</span>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: 136/134/130/121/118</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating:  77.2/74.7/72.2/69.1/66.2</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Golf Clubs"]}]},{"id":5757613957,"title":"Mauna Lani North Course Special","handle":"mauna-lani-north-course-special","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6913 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<br> </b></p>\n<div>\n<div>\n<p>Mauna Lani's North Course is rated as one of the best golf experiences on the Big Island of Hawaii and has since become one of the most popular tournament venues on the Island. </p>\n<p>Built on a lava bed, the North is characterized by rolling terrain punctuated by Kiawe forests.  Number 17, is the North's signature hole, par 3, measuring 140 yards, and requires a tee shot from an elevated tee to a green that is framed by a natural lava amphitheatre, and a favorite \"I was here\" photo spot. </p>\n<p>A 230-acre protected archaeological district lies on the northern boundary of the golf course. Herds of feral goats frequent the entire golf course, moving from hole to hole throughout the day.  </p>\n<p>There are as many as five different tee positions on most of the holes to give golfers a wide range of options in meeting the challenging conditions. With the Groves of twisted kiawe trees along the fairway edges and a more pronounced topography make the holes seem quite a contrast from the south 18. Water hazards come into play, and several holes are contiguous with the ocean.</p>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 68-1050 Makaiwa Place, Kohala Coast, HI 96743</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: H. 2 pm"]}]},{"id":263015365,"title":"Mauna Lani North","handle":"mauna-lani-resort-north-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6913 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><br> </b></p>\n<div>\n<div>\n<p>Mauna Lani's North Course has fast become one of the most popular tournament venues on the Big Island and rated as one of the best golf experiences in all of Hawaii. Built on a lava bed, the North Course is characterized by rolling terrain punctuated by Kiawe forests. Number 17 is the North's signature hole, a par 3 measuring 140 yards which requires a tee shot from an elevated tee to a green that is framed by an astounding natural lava amphitheater, a photo opportunity you don't want to miss!</p>\n<p>A 230-acre protected archaeological district lies on the northern boundary of the golf course. Another interesting feature would be that herds of feral goats also like to frequent the entire golf course, moving from hole to hole throughout the day.  </p>\n<p>There are as many as five different tee positions on most of the holes to give golfers a wide range of options in meeting the challenging conditions. With the groves of twisted kiawe trees along the fairway edges and a more pronounced topography the holes are quite contrasting to the South Course. Water hazards also come into play on many holes, not to mention several holes that neighbor the beautiful Pacific Ocean.</p>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 68-1050 Makaiwa Place, Kohala Coast, HI 9674343</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: H. Flint, R. F. Cain &amp; R. Nelson</td>\n<td>Director of Golf:  Chris Noda</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1981</td>\n<td>Golf Professional:  Jeff Keys</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 holes, par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage:  6913/6601/6084/5383</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: : sprinklers</td>\n<td>Slope: Twilight 12pm","Mauna Lani 2 Days","Mauna Lani 2 Day","Mahalo Challenge"]}]},{"id":263014921,"title":"Mauna Lani South","handle":"mauna-lani-resort-south-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6938 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<br> </b></p>\n<div>Mauna Lani’s South Course is home to Hole #15, one of the most photographed over-the-water golf course holes in the world. Renowned as the former home to the annual Senior Skins Game from 1990 - 2000, the course snakes through the stark, rugged a'a lava of the prehistoric Kaniku lava flow. The challenging South Course offers golfers panoramic views of both rugged mountains as well as calming, beautiful ocean.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The South Courses fairways are composed of Bermuda grass which are lined by the natural rough along with pahoehoe and a'a lava rock, which causes quite demanding holes. Signature holes on the South Course that play beside the ocean are the 7th, 13th, 16th and of course the famous 15th.</div>\n<div>During the winter months golfers can enjoy watching humpback whales migrating offshore merely yards from these holes. Most of the greens are flat, yet sometimes difficult in determining the speed as there are many subtle breaks which can be hard to spot with the naked eye. Take it from us, playing Mauna Lani South is a must for any golfer visiting the Big Island.</div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 68-1050 Makaiwa Place, Kohala Coast, HI 96743</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: H. Flint, R. F. Cain &amp; R. Nelson</td>\n<td>Director of Golf:  Chris Noda</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1991</td>\n<td>Golf Professional:  Jeff Keys</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Twilight 12 pm","Mauna Lani 2 Day","Mauna Lani 2 Days","Kahakai Challenge (*Mauna Kea after 11 am)"]}]},{"id":114786008,"title":"Kapolei Golf Course","handle":"kapolei-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7001 yards. All prices per person and include range balls and golf cart rentals. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Located west of Pearl Harbor in sunny Kapolei, the par-72 championship layout is beautifully landscaped with floral gardens, thousands of coconut palms and five expansive lakes. Architect Ted Robinson, who is known for his creative use of water, moved massive amounts of dirt to create the lakes and to provide elevation and contouring for the course. The beautiful lakes come into play on 12 holes and in addition to being aesthetically pleasing, serve an important environmental function, catching storm run-off from the surrounding terrain.</p>\n<p>Kapolei measures 7001 yards from the back tees but with multiple tee positions the course can be enjoyed by all levels of golfers. More than 80 bunkers, elevated greens and gently contoured fairways add to the challenge of this award winning course.</p>\n<p>Having been rated as one of the best courses on Oahu by both <em>Golf Digest</em> and <em>Golf Advisor</em>, Kapolei Golf Club also played host to the LPGA's Hawaiian Ladies Open Tournament between 1996-2001 and for the last few years the Champions Tour Pacific Links Open.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" Valley","handle":"makaha-valley-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6369 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span></b></p>\n<p>Located about 45 miles from Waikiki, the Makaha Valley East Course has some of the most scenic vistas of the west side of Oahu. Hugging the Waianae Mountain Range, majestic views of Mt. Kaala are visible from every hole.<span> </span>In contrast to the bustle of Waikiki this area of Waianae is very quaint and calm, and makes for an enjoyably serene round of golf.</p>\n<p>In addition to the mountain views, the par-72 William Francis Bell design also features plenty of ocean views, with a variety of doglegs and elevation changes.<span>  </span>A full service restaurant and driving range await guests before or after their round.</p>\n <!--Paste code here --> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" / Makaha 2 Day","Menehune Challenge","Morning","After 11 am"]}]},{"id":114786146,"title":"Makaha Valley ft","handle":"makaha-valley-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6369 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span></b></p>\n<p>Located about 45 miles from Waikiki, the Makaha Valley East Course has some of the most scenic vistas of the west side of Oahu. Hugging the Waianae Mountain Range, majestic views of Mt. Kaala are visible from every hole.<span> </span>In contrast to the bustle of Waikiki this area of Waianae is very quaint and calm, and makes for an enjoyably serene round of golf.</p>\n<p>In addition to the mountain views, the par-72 William Francis Bell design also features plenty of ocean views, with a variety of doglegs and elevation changes.<span>  </span>A full service restaurant and driving range await guests before or after their round.</p>\n <!--Paste code here --> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" 11 am","Morning (from Jan 1)","After 11 am (from Jan 1)"]}]},{"id":1320888139855,"title":"Makani Golf Club","handle":"makani-golf-club","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7136 yards. All prices are per person and include golf,golf cart rentals and range balls.</b></p>\n<p>Makani Golf Club (Previously Big Island Country Club) is a Dye Design course, located 2300 above sea level in the cool mountain air above Kona, Big Island Country Club is one of the best examples of Hawaii's treasure trove golf courses. The course is home to Paspalum greens, Kikuyu Grass fairways and spectacular Island Green, hole #17. Makani Golf Club also has five sets of tee boxes ranging from 4803-7116 yards which give all caliber of player an enjoyable experience. <br> <br> This course is at a higher elevation than typical Hawaiian courses. The fairways are slightly rolling and play host to over 2,000 different types of vegetation. Their signature 17th hole is a par-3 with an island green and all of the courses medium-sized greens are undulating and moderate in speed. Makani Golf  Club is also home to many water hazards, which come into play on 9 of the 18 holes.</p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table {"products":[{"id":1315839049807,"title":"Big Island CC (Makani)","handle":"big-island-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7136 yards. All prices are per person and include golf,golf cart rentals and range balls. </b></p>\n<p>Big Island Country Club (As of May 1. 2018 the course is now called Makani Golf Club) is a Design course, located 2300 above sea level in the cool mountain air above Kona, Big Island Country Club is one of the best examples of Hawaii's treasure trove golf courses. The course is home to Paspalum greens, Kikuyu Grass fairways and spectacular Island Green, hole #17. Makani Golf Club also has five sets of tee boxes ranging from 4803-7116 yards which give all caliber of player an enjoyable experience. <br> <br> This course is at a higher elevation than typical Hawaiian courses. The fairways are slightly rolling and play host to over 2,000 different types of vegetation. Their signature 17th hole is a par-3 with an island green and all of the courses medium-sized greens are undulating and moderate in speed. Makani Golf Club is also home to many water hazards, which come into play on 9 of the 18 holes.</p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td FT","handle":"big-island-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7136 yards. All prices are per person and include golf,golf cart rentals and range balls.  <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\">(Course changed its name to Makani Golf Club on May 1. 2018).</span></b></p>\n<p>Makani Golf Club is A Dye Design course, located 2300 above sea level in the cool mountain air above Kona, Makani Golf Club is one of the best examples of Hawaii's treasure trove golf courses. The course is home to Paspalum greens, Kikuyu Grass fairways and spectacular Island Green, hole #17. Makani Golf Club also has five sets of tee boxes ranging from 4803-7116 yards which give all caliber of player an enjoyable experience. <br> <br> This course is at a higher elevation than typical Hawaiian courses. The fairways are slightly rolling and play host to over 2,000 different types of vegetation. Their signature 17th hole is a par-3 with an island green and all of the courses medium-sized greens are undulating and moderate in speed. Big Island Country Club is also home to many water hazards, which come into play on 9 of the 18 holes.</p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table 8 am","Morning after 8 am","After 10 am","Twilight 1 pm"]}]},{"id":141554635,"title":"Waikoloa Beach Special","handle":"waikoloa-beach-daily-special","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 70, 6566 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <br> </b></p>\n<div>Designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr., the Beach Course at Waikoloa winds its way along historic lava flows near Anaehoomalu Bay. The Beach course truly has it all, a great mix of challenging holes with birdie opportunities, spectacular scenery and a layout strategic enough to challenge the pro’s while gentle enough to allow even the casual player an enjoyable day on the course. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>From the fairway the player is treated to the most stunning views of any course in the world. The green fairways sit on a lava peninsula surrounded by swaying coconut palms. With beautiful visuals as a carpet of emerald green, contrasting against the stunning blues of the Pacific Ocean crashing on the black lava sending spray cascading in the air.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The seventh is one of the most photographed holes in the entire Hawaiian Islands and a classic risk reward hole in every sense of the word. Hole # 17 is a wonderful par three over water surrounded by an amphitheater of black lava. Don’t forget your camera when playing this stunning course.</div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" Beach FT","handle":"waikoloa-beach-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 70, 6566 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <br></b>Designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr., the Beach Course at Waikoloa winds its way along historic lava flows near Anaehoomalu Bay. The Beach course truly has it all, a great mix of challenging holes with birdie opportunities, spectacular scenery and a layout strategic enough to challenge the pro’s while gentle enough to allow even the casual player an enjoyable day on the course. <br><br>Waikoloa Beach Golf Course offers some of the most stunning views of any course in the world. The whole course sits on a lava peninsula surrounded by swaying coconut palms, and beautiful visuals of emerald green carpet-like fairways contrast against the stunning blues of the Pacific Ocean that crashes against the black lava, which occasionally sends ocean mist cascading into the air.<br><br>The seventh is the Beach Courses signature hole, a classic risk/reward hole that is also one of the most photographed holes in the entire Hawaiian Islands. Hole #17 is another great hole, a wonderful par three over water surrounded by an amphitheater of black lava. You won't want to forget your camera when playing this stunning course!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" + Golf Clubs","After 11 am","After 12:30 pm"]}]},{"id":114782066,"title":"Waikoloa Kings FT","handle":"waikoloa-kings-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7074 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. </b></p>\n<p>Waikoloa Kings Golf Course is truly a player’s course. It has length and lingering trade winds that can pick up in the late afternoon. This alone would be enough to challenge a good player, yet the course also is known for its unique lava landscape which can definitely be a considerable distraction.<br><br>Designed by the team of Tom Weiskopf and Jay Morrish the 7074 yard Kings Course meanders over and around the ancient black lava flow, and its wide, undulating fairways are framed by palm trees and vibrant flowers of Hawaii. The beautiful Kings Course plays inland towards the ancient mountain of Mauna Kea, ever present in the distance.<br><br>From the 5th hole green, perched up a few feet above the fairway golfers get a magnificent view of the surrounding lava fields, which stretch as far as the eye can see. This is camera time no matter what your score. Majestic fairways interspersed throughout ancient lava fields – it has even been compared to playing golf on the moon!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table 2564509,"created_at":"2014-06-12T05:01:33-10:00","position":15,"updated_at":"2019-08-16T12:04:52-10:00","product_id":114782066,"variant_ids":[],"src":"https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0191/3924/products/kings6web.jpg?v=1565993092","width":800,"height":450}],"options":[{"name":"Title","position":1,"values":["Morning","Morning + Golf Clubs","After 11 am","After 12:30 pm"]}]},{"id":2405318492239,"title":"Kaneohe Bay View","handle":"kaneohe-bay-view","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 60, 3399 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <br></b></p>\n<p>Bay Golf Park overlooking beautiful Kaneohe Bay, is a majestic par 60 course with brand new golf carts added in 2018.</p>\n<p>Bay View Golf Park underwent a redesign and rebuilding in the mid-1990's and re-opened its new Robin Nelson design in 1997. It is known for being the perfect course for working on your short game, features a single double green and is even open for night play during the week. (The course updated all their golf carts in spring 2018)<br><br>The view from the par-3 14th is more than worth the price of admission, with its commanding view of Kaneohe Bay you will even be able to spot Chinaman's Hat in the far north. The front nine incorporates much of the land from the original layout, which was built in the 1960's. However, it is the back nine that offers a number of engaging holes. The 11th and 12th holes may be the toughest back-to-back par-4's of any Oahu golf course, and are certainly the narrowest.<br><br>The par-4 on hole 15 features a water carry to an elevated green carved out of the hillside, while the 16th is a massive downhill par-3 with water right and even more danger at left over the hill. Bay View closes with an all-carry par-3 across a wetland to a shallow but wide green protected by a huge mound at its center.<br><br>The course has 14 par-3's and 4 par-4's.</p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Holes with Cart","For visual","Blackout"]}]},{"id":116897662,"title":"Kaneohe Bay View FT","handle":"bay-view-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 60, 3399 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <br></b></p>\n<p>Bay Golf Park overlooking beautiful Kaneohe Bay, is a majestic par 60 course with brand new golf carts added in 2018.</p>\n<p>Bay View Golf Park underwent a redesign and rebuilding in the mid-1990's and re-opened its new Robin Nelson design in 1997. It is known for being the perfect course for working on your short game, features a single double green and is even open for night play during the week. (The course updated all their golf carts in spring 2018)<br><br>The view from the par-3 14th is more than worth the price of admission, with its commanding view of Kaneohe Bay you will even be able to spot Chinaman's Hat in the far north. The front nine incorporates much of the land from the original layout, which was built in the 1960's. However, it is the back nine that offers a number of engaging holes. The 11th and 12th holes may be the toughest back-to-back par-4's of any Oahu golf course, and are certainly the narrowest.<br><br>The par-4 on hole 15 features a water carry to an elevated green carved out of the hillside, while the 16th is a massive downhill par-3 with water right and even more danger at left over the hill. Bay View closes with an all-carry par-3 across a wetland to a shallow but wide green protected by a huge mound at its center.<br><br>The course has 14 par-3's and 4 par-4's.</p>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Holes with Cart","For visual"]}]},{"id":114786262,"title":"Royal Kunia FT","handle":"royal-kunia-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7007 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. </b></p>\n<p>Located only 30 minutes from Waikiki high above the Ewa Plains, this Robin Nelson designed course boasts panoramic views of the entire south shore of Oahu. From certain areas throughout the course you're able to see the famous Pearl Harbor Memorial, the city of Honolulu, well-known Diamond Head Monument and the rugged Ko’olau and Waianae Mountain Ranges.</p>\n<p>This par-72 track features generously sized rolling Bermuda fairways, heavily bunkered greens and a generous amount of well-placed lakes. Interestingly, this now extremely popular course sat idle for almost ten years between 1994 and 2003, before finally reopening to an eagerly awaiting cast of golfers.</p>\n<p>Royal Kunia has arguably some of the best par 5's on the island, especially the back to back 9th and 10th holes, that both measure over 600 yards in length from the championship tees. If you are looking for a course that provides great views, has exceptional conditions and a course that is a test for all levels of golfers, this the course for you.</p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Bird before 7 am","Morning","Afternoon 1 pm","Twilight 2:30 pm"]}]},{"id":114786226,"title":"Pearl Country Club","handle":"pearl-golf-course","body_html":"<p><strong></strong>18<b> holes, par 72, 6787 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> (Golfers from outside of the USA will be charged the Non-US rate.) </span></b></p>\n<p>With it's stunning views of Pearl Harbor, you're able to see both the USS Arizona Memorial and the USS Missouri from various locations on this course. In addition to the Pearl Harbor Memorial the Waianae Mountain Range can also be viewed towards the west, making Pearl Country Club a long time favorite among residents and visitors alike.<span>  </span>The par-72 Akira Sato designed course is only about a 20 minute drive from Waikiki and is always in great condition.</p>\n<p>Pearl Country Club features rugged, rolling terrain and is lined with Northfolk Pine, Coconut Palms and flowering Monkeypod Trees. There are relatively few water hazards or fairway bunkers, however, trees, terrain, and fast greens contribute to this fun and challenging test. A local tip that will be sure to save you several strokes is that all putts will break towards the Pearl Harbor Memorial.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" (USA Mainland)","Morning (Non US)","Menehune Challenge"]}]},{"id":204136737,"title":"Ko Olina Golf Club Special","handle":"ko-olina-golf-club-special","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><a href=\"#details\"></a><b>18 holes, par 72, 6867 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.  <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p><b> </b>Located on the west coast of the island at the KoOlina resort, the Ted Robinson designed KoOlina Golf Club is one of the few resort courses located on Oahu.<span>  </span>The par-72 layout features generous landing areas, multi-tiered greens, cascading waterfalls and a picturesque ocean location.</p>\n<p>The 170-acre), par-72 golf course opened in January 1990, hosting the LPGA Tour's Hawaiian Ladies Open from 1990 to 1995, the Senior PGA Tour's Ko Olina Senior Invitational in 1992 and the Fields Open in Hawaii from 2006 to 2008. Women's professional golf returned in April 2012 with the inaugural LPGA Lotte Championship, won by Ai Miyazato. The LPGA Lotte Championship winner in 2014 was Hawaii's own Michelle Wie.</p>\n<!--Paste code here --> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<p> </p>\n<table class=\"details_course\" Olina 2 Day"]}]},{"id":184594201,"title":"Ko Olina Golf Club ft","handle":"ko-olina-golf-club-ft","body_html":"<p>18<b> holes, par 72, 6867 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\">(If you need transportation, we require 24 hours notice) </span></span></b></p>\n<p>Ko Olina has been recognized by <em>Golf Digest</em> as one of the \"Top 75 Resort Courses in the USA\". The course includes 16 water features on 8 different holes, multi-tiered greens and well-manicured fairways. Ko Olina will challenge golfers to use every club in the bag with its demanding par-3's, well bunkered greens and gentle trade winds.</p>\n<p>Located on the west coast of the island inside the Ko Olina Resort, the Ted Robinson designed course is one of the only resort courses located on Oahu.<span>  </span>The par-72 layout features generous landing areas, cascading waterfalls and a picturesque ocean location. From the back tees Ko Olina measures 6867 yards and is always superbly maintained.</p>\n<p>Ko Olina opened in January 1990, hosting the LPGA Tour's Hawaiian Ladies Open from 1990 to 1995, the Senior PGA Tour's Ko Olina Senior Invitational in 1992 and the Fields Open in Hawaii from 2006 to 2008. Ko Olina is also home to the LPGA LOTTE Championship, which returned in 2012 and takes place every April. This years winner (2018) was Brooke Henderson with a winning score of -12 or 276.</p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table Special","handle":"hawaii-prince-golf-club-special","body_html":"<p><b>27 holes A/B/C, par 72, 7117-7255 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><span> </span></span></b></p>\n<p>Designed by Arnold Palmer and Ed Seay, this unique course boasts 27 dramatic holes - the only golf course of its kind in Hawaii. It occupies 270 acres of sheer beauty and offers stunning views of the rain-carved Waianae mountains.</p>\n<p>Located about 40 minutes from Waikiki on the Ewa Plains, Hawaii Prince facility features 27 holes.  Each of the 9’s are designated A, B or C, and the abundant number of water features is the dominant characteristic of this track.  Within the property of the golf course there are 10 lakes, which come in to play in over half of the holes. </p>\n<p>In addition to its 27 holes the Hawaii Prince Golf Club sports an excellent practice facility and features a full service clubhouse with a terrific restaurant.  Hawaii Tee Times also offers 2 shuttle service drop offs daily to the course.</p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" & Tuesday Special","10:36 a.m. Special","Blackout"]}]},{"id":141542421,"title":"Ewa Beach Daily Special","handle":"ewa-beach-daily-special","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6711 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Ewa Beach Golf Club is very popular amongst the locals, and features design elements commonly found in Scottish Links golf.<span>  </span>The outward nine takes players straight away from the pro shop, while the inward nine comes back in to the pro shop, and the course also features a double green similar to those found at the Old Course at Saint Andrews.</p>\n<p>The course measures just over 6700 yards and boasts rolling, tree-lined fairways, water hazards, and numerous bunkers. The signature hole of Ewa Beach Golf Club is the par-3 13th, which requires a tee shot into the wind and over water.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td G.M.</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1992</td>\n<td>Golf Professional:  Aileen Yamauchi - pro shop mgr.</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 holes, Par 72</td>\n<td>Yardage:  6711/6312/5861/4894</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: : sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope: Beach Golf Course FT","handle":"ewa-beach-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6711 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>The Ewa Beach Golf Club is an alluring semi-private golf course tucked away in a forest of Hawaiian Kiawe trees. When you visit Ewa Beach Golf Club you'll be impressed by the strikingly beautiful natural surroundings and incredible course conditions.</p>\n<p>Ewa Beach Golf Club is very popular amongst the locals and features design elements commonly found in Scottish Links golf.<span>  Much like traditional courses in earlier days Ewa has an outward and inward nine rather than a \"front\" and \"back\". </span>Ewa Beach is also one of the only courses on the island that features a massive double green, again, similar to that of the historic Old Course at St. Andrews.</p>\n<p>The course measures just over 6700 yards and boasts narrow tree-lined fairways, water hazards and numerous bunkers. The signature hole at Ewa Beach Golf Club is the beautiful par-3 13th, which requires a skilled tee shot into the wind and over water. </p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table width=\"100%\" class=\"details_course\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Otake </td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1992</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Glen Klaiber</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 (after 12:30 pm)"]}]},{"id":247616536585,"title":"Wailea Blue","handle":"wailea-old-blue-golf-course","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6545 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. </b></p>\n<div></div>\n<div>Wailea Blue offers up a golf experience that is truly classic. As the first course ever built in Wailea, The Blue laid claim to the lay of the land that would put Wailea on everyone’s wish list of places to visit.  <br> </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The course winds its way on a tour of the resort while serving up views of the neighboring islands on one side and 10,023-foot dormant volcano, Mt. Haleakala on the other. Now, after all these years, The  Blue continues to welcome back many golfers who feel that a trip to Maui is not complete without a round or two on The Blue course. <br> </div>\n<div>With views of the Pacific Ocean, several offshore islands, a volcanic cinder cone known as Pu'u Olai and majestic Mount Haleakala, it features several fountains and lakes and an abundance of colorful Hibiscus, Wiliwili Trees, Bougainvillea and Plumeria, not to mention lush, wide fairways and large greens. With all of these aspects as well as superb course conditions the Wailea Blue really is the definition of classic golf in paradise.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 120 Kaukahi Street, Wailea, Maui, HI 96753</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Jack Snyder</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Barry Helle</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1972</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Brenda Rego</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 71</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6545/6173/5037</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope: 129/126M/130L/117L</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Rating: 71.6/69.8/</td>\n<td>Bunkers: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Golf Carts: yes</td>\n<td>Pull Carts: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Water Holes: yes</td>\n<td>Caddies: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Five-somes Policy: no</td>\n<td>Walking: no</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Greens:Tifton</td>\n<td>Fairways:Tifdwarf</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Dress Code: proper golf attire</td>\n<td>Spike Policy: soft spike only</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>GPS Tracking: yes</td>\n<td>Lessons: yes</td>\n</tr>\n<tr
