Blue Special","handle":"wailea-blue-special","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6545 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. </b></p>\n<div></div>\n<div>Wailea Blue offers up a golf experience that is truly classic. As the first course ever built in Wailea, The Blue laid claim to the lay of the land that would put Wailea on everyone’s wish list of places to visit.  <br> </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The course winds its way on a tour of the resort while serving up views of the neighboring islands on one side and 10,023-foot dormant volcano, Mt. Haleakala on the other. Now, after all these years, The  Blue continues to welcome back many golfers who feel that a trip to Maui is not complete without a round or two on The Blue course. <br> </div>\n<div>With views of the Pacific Ocean, several offshore islands, a volcanic cinder cone known as Pu'u Olai and majestic Mount Haleakala, it features several fountains and lakes and an abundance of colorful Hibiscus, Wiliwili Trees, Bougainvillea and Plumeria, not to mention lush, wide fairways and large greens. With all of these aspects as well as superb course conditions the Wailea Blue really is the definition of classic golf in paradise.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Helle</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1972</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Brenda Rego</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 71</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6545/6173/5037</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: sprinkler heads</td>\n<td>Slope: 129/126M/130L/117L</td>\n</tr>\n<tr ft","handle":"wailea-old-blue-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6545 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. </b></p>\n<div></div>\n<div>Wailea Blue offers up a golf experience that is truly classic. As the first course ever built in Wailea, The Blue laid claim to the lay of the land that would put Wailea on everyone’s wish list of places to visit.  <br> </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The course winds its way on a tour of the resort while serving up views of the neighboring islands on one side and 10,023-foot dormant volcano, Mt. Haleakala on the other. Now, after all these years, The  Blue continues to welcome back many golfers who feel that a trip to Maui is not complete without a round or two on The Blue course. <br> </div>\n<div>With views of the Pacific Ocean, several offshore islands, a volcanic cinder cone known as Pu'u Olai and majestic Mount Haleakala, it features several fountains and lakes and an abundance of colorful Hibiscus, Wiliwili Trees, Bougainvillea and Plumeria, not to mention lush, wide fairways and large greens. With all of these aspects as well as superb course conditions the Wailea Blue really is the definition of classic golf in paradise.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td May 1)","After 10 am-9 hole (from May 1)","After 12 pm-9 Hole (from May 1)"]}]},{"id":114785758,"title":"Coral Creek Golf Course ft","handle":"coral-creek-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<b>18 holes, par 72, 6808 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. <br><br></b>Located in Ewa Beach (west of Waikiki), Coral Creek Golf Course provides a challenging test for golfers of all skill levels. The Robin Nelson designed par-72 course weaves its way through exposed natural coral rock formations, resulting in a truly unique golfing experience. The course also offers several water features including a 30 ft. waterfall. It measures just over 6800 yards from the back tees and boasts beautifully manicured Seashore Paspalum Turf.<br><br>Nestled along the Ewa Plain, Coral Creek Golf Course offers one of the most unique and beautiful pieces of land in Oahu. You will be catered to from the moment you enter the property. From bag drop off to country club service, you will find every detail has been taken care of to provide you with the most enjoyable visit. <br><br>The golf course also has a full-service practice facility featuring a full-length driving range with 25 hitting stations, practice putting greens and a chipping area which includes a practice bunker.\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table (after 12pm)"]}]},{"id":1316333912143,"title":"Wailea Gold","handle":"wailea-gold-golf-club","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7078 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<br><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> <br></span></b>Wailea Gold Course was the home course of The Champions Skins Game from 2001 to 2007. The 7078-yard Gold Course is the most challenging of three Wailea Courses and plays to 7100 yards from the back tees.The course is known for having more bunkers and narrower fairways than its sister Emerald and Blue Courses.</p>\n<div>\n<br>Designed by Robert Trent Jones II, the Gold was honored by both <em>Golf Magazine</em> and <em>Golf Digest</em> as one of the country’s ten best new resort courses when it opened in 1994. Known as a “thinking player’s course\", the Gold offers a true test to a golfers skills. You will enjoy spectacular vistas of the ocean, Molokini islet, ancient lava rock walls, coconut trees and sparkling white bunkers.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Maui Historical Society recognized the course for its preservation of prehistoric lava rock walls during construction, and hailed it as one of the world’s best designed courses by the readers of <em>Conde Nast Traveler</em> in the magazine’s first golf resorts poll. The Gold's 200 foot elevation change from top to bottom enhances the numerous ocean and mountain views available from virtually every hole..<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td Marcus Judge</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1994</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: Michael Taylor</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: $119"]}]},{"id":1316332765263,"title":"Wailea Emerald","handle":"wailea-emerald-golf-club","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6825 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span></b></p>\nDesigned as a fun course for every skill level, the 6825-yard Wailea Emerald Course is one of <span>the country’s most women-friendly golf clubs, according to </span><em>Golf for Women Magazine</em> who first granted the Wailea Golf Club the \"Top Fairways Award\" over a decade ago and has since then had the honor of winning that same award six additional times.<br><br>In the sunny, usually warmer end of Maui, The Emerald Course delights players with its carpet-like fairways, colorful foliage and numerous vistas of the Pacific Ocean and Mt. Haleakala. With less forced carries and kinder fairways than the Gold Course, conditions are great for players who view golf as an enjoyable form of recreation rather than a grueling test of concentration and precision. <br><br>Measuring 6825 yards from the back tees, the Emerald features four to six tee boxes on every hole, allowing players to play the course to their playing level. A strong notable feature includes a large double green shared by holes #10 and #17. The course also has 10 fewer sand traps, wider fairways and slightly more ocean views than can be seen from the Gold Course.<br><br>  <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table SPECIAL"]}]},{"id":170096862,"title":"Wailea Gold ft","handle":"wailea-gold-golf-club-ft","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7078 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><br><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> <br></span></b>Wailea Gold Course was the home course of The Champions Skins Game from 2001 to 2007. The 7078-yard Gold Course is the most challenging of three Wailea Courses and plays to 7100 yards from the back tees.The course is known for having more bunkers and narrower fairways than its sister Emerald and Blue Courses.</p>\n<div>\n<br>Designed by Robert Trent Jones II, the Gold was honored by both <em>Golf Magazine</em> and <em>Golf Digest</em> as one of the country’s ten best new resort courses when it opened in 1994. Known as a “thinking player’s course\", the Gold offers a true test to a golfers skills. You will enjoy spectacular vistas of the ocean, Molokini islet, ancient lava rock walls, coconut trees and sparkling white bunkers.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Maui Historical Society recognized the course for its preservation of prehistoric lava rock walls during construction, and hailed it as one of the world’s best designed courses by the readers of <em>Conde Nast Traveler</em> in the magazine’s first golf resorts poll. The Gold's 200 foot elevation change from top to bottom enhances the numerous ocean and mountain views available from virtually every hole.<br><br>\n</div>\n<div></div>\n<br> <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td 10 am","After 12 pm","After 3pm","Morning (from May 1)","After 10 am (from May 1)","After 3 pm (from May 1)"]}]},{"id":170080292,"title":"Wailea Emerald ft","handle":"wailea-emerald-golf-club-ft","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6825 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span></b></p>\nDesigned as a fun course for every skill level, the 6825-yard Wailea Emerald Course is one of <span>the country’s most women-friendly golf clubs, according to </span><em>Golf for Women Magazine</em> who first granted the Wailea Golf Club the \"Top Fairways Award\" over a decade ago and has since then had the honor of winning that same award six additional times.<br><br>In the sunny, usually warmer end of Maui, The Emerald Course delights players with its carpet-like fairways, colorful foliage and numerous vistas of the Pacific Ocean and Mt. Haleakala. With less forced carries and kinder fairways than the Gold Course, conditions are great for players who view golf as an enjoyable form of recreation rather than a grueling test of concentration and precision. <br><br>Measuring 6825 yards from the back tees, the Emerald features four to six tee boxes on every hole, allowing players to play the course to their playing level. A strong notable feature includes a large double green shared by holes #10 and #17. The course also has 10 fewer sand traps, wider fairways and slightly more ocean views than can be seen from the Gold Course.<br><br>  <a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table Groupon","handle":"maui-nui-golf-course-groupon","body_html":"<p><b>Groupon online booking instructions:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Please have your Groupon activation code ready.</b></li>\n<li><b>First select the correct choice which matches your Groupon purchase for either One, Two or Four players. </b></li>\n<li><b>Select the date you want to play,</b></li>\n<li><b>Leave the quantity set at 1,</b></li>\n<li><b>Enter your Name,</b></li>\n<li><b>Enter the Hotel or Place your are staying at in Maui, *(Optional)</b></li>\n<li><b>Click the \"Add to Cart\" Button.</b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>On the next page</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Review Your Order,</b></li>\n<li><b>Tick the \"I agree to Terms and conditions\" box,</b></li>\n<li><b>Click the \"Checkout\" Button.</b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><b></b><b>On the next page</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Add your Groupon activation code to the discount box on the right,</b></li>\n<li><b>Click Apply,</b></li>\n<li><b>Complete the Customer information section, on the left,</b></li>\n<li><b>Click the \"Continue to Payment Method\" button,</b></li>\n<li><b>Click \"Complete Order\".</b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Or feel free to call our staff with your Groupon activation code during Hawaii Business hours at 1.877.465.3170</b> </p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6801 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.</b></p>\n<p>Elleair Maui Golf Club, now called <strong>Maui Nui Golf Club</strong> located in Kihei, is suitable for any player or skill-level. Features include an inviting opening hole, reachable par 5's, exceptional views of the Pacific Ocean, Mt. Haleakala, Molokini and the West Maui Mountains.<br><br>The course is continually being improved to make it even more golfer friendly, with widening of the fairways, reshaping and enlarging of greens and the installation of a new hybrid Bermuda turf grass. Maui Nui is not only one of the best value courses but has some of the best weather on the island as well.</p>\n<p>Maui Nui, originally known as Silversword, was designed by architect Bill Newis and first opened in 1987. With an interesting layout, the course was designed with the trade winds in mind, which usually hit the course in the late afternoon. Maui Nui rewards those who play the fundamentals well: keeping the ball in play, putting, chipping and playing within themselves; it is the fairest test of golf on Maui. </p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 470 Lipoa Holes of Golf Plus Cart for One","18 Holes of Golf Plus Cart for Two","18 Holes of Golf Plus Cart for Four"]}]},{"id":147152087,"title":"Maui Nui Golf Course FT","handle":"maui-nui-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 71, 6801 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <br><br></b><strong>Maui Nui Golf Club</strong> located in Kihei, is suitable for any player or skill-level. Features include an inviting opening hole, reachable par 5's, exceptional views of the Pacific Ocean, Mt. Haleakala, Molokini and the West Maui Mountains.<br><br>The course is continually being improved to make it even more golfer friendly, with widening of the fairways, reshaping and enlarging of greens and the installation of a new hybrid Bermuda turf grass. Maui Nui is not only one of the best value courses but has some of the best weather on the island as well.</p>\n<p>Maui Nui, originally known as Silversword, was designed by architect Bill Newis and first opened in 1987. With an interesting layout, the course was designed with the trade winds in mind, which usually hit the course in the late afternoon. Maui Nui rewards those who play the fundamentals well: keeping the ball in play, putting, chipping and playing within themselves; it is the fairest test of golf on Maui.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td colspan=\"2\">Address: 470 Lipoa Parkway, Kihei HI 96753</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Architect: Bill Newis</td>\n<td>Director of Golf: Lief Smith</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Open: 1987</td>\n<td>Golf Professional: n/a</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">\n<td>Course Type: 18 hole, par 71</td>\n<td>Yardage: 6801/6404/6003/5265</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: #f5f8f1;\">\n<td>Yardage Markers: palm trees at 150 yards</td>\n<td>Slope: 135/132/129/122</td>\n</tr>\n<tr style=\"background-color: Course","handle":"kiahuna-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 70, 6925 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.</b></p>\n<p>Kiahuna Golf Club is located in sunny Poipu Beach and surrounded by the lush, natural beauty of Kauai. Architect Robert Trent Jones Jr. skillfully included many ancient remnants of an authentic Hawaiian Village into his vision when designing the course. </p>\n<div></div>\n<div>Kiahuna Golf Club offers challenging resort golf within a fascinating area of ancient Polynesian archaeology, as it is structured around the remains of authentic Hawaiian culture. This challenging course has narrow fairways and you will encounter unusual obstacles such as lava walls and stone structures.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Kiahuna Golf Club is a sanctuary for many of Kauai’s endangered species including the state bird of Hawaii, the Nene. The Black-Crowned Night Heron can be seen fishing along the clubs numerous water hazards. Golfers may also spot the rare Hawaiian Stilt and the very shy Moorhen along Waikomo Stream.</div>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table ft","handle":"kiahuna-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 70, 6925 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.</b></p>\n<p>Kiahuna Golf Club is located in sunny Poipu Beach and surrounded by the lush, natural beauty of Kauai. Architect Robert Trent Jones Jr. skillfully included many ancient remnants of an authentic Hawaiian Village into his vision when designing the course. </p>\n<div></div>\n<div>Kiahuna Golf Club offers challenging resort golf within a fascinating area of ancient Polynesian archaeology, as it is structured around the remains of authentic Hawaiian culture. This challenging course has narrow fairways and you will encounter unusual obstacles such as lava walls and stone structures.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Kiahuna Golf Club is a sanctuary for many of Kauai’s endangered species including the state bird of Hawaii, the Nene. The Black-Crowned Night Heron can be seen fishing along the clubs numerous water hazards. Golfers may also spot the rare Hawaiian Stilt and the very shy Moorhen along Waikomo Stream.</div>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table Club FT","handle":"waikoloa-village-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6791 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"></span><br><br></b>The second oldest course on the Big Island and a local favorite, Waikoloa Village Golf Club is situated in an arid location, nestled in the foothills of Mauna Kea overlooking the Pacific Ocean, which virtually assures good playing conditions 365 days per year.<br><br>This Robert Trent Jones Jr. designed course features generous fairways with wide, forgiving landing areas which encourage aggressive tee shots and the large and well well-bunkered, undulating greens provide a test for any level of golfer. Located at approximately 1,000 feet of elevation, golfers are treated to views of five volcanoes - Kohala, Mauna Kea, Mauna Loa, Hualalai and Haleakala on Maui as well as the Kohala coastline.<br><br>The course is challenging enough for the serious golfer, but fun for beginners as well. The 6791-yard par-72 course has all of the feel of a Jones design, with additional challenges unique to this island landscape. Waikoloa Village Golf Course fits harmoniously into the natural beauty of the setting. One of Hawaii's best-kept secrets, with practice facilities and a pro shop stocked with golf equipment and accessories the Waikoloa Village Golf Course is a great place to practice, shop and most of all play golf.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\" cellpadding=\"3\">\n<tbody>\n<tr 2:30 pm","Morning (from Apr 1)","After 2:30 pm (from Apr 1)"]}]},{"id":114781894,"title":"Volcano Golf  Club","handle":"volcano-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6547 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.<br> </b></p>\n<div>Volcano Golf Club is an 18 hole, par 72, 6547 yard course. It is located in Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, making it an ever scenic 30-mile drive up from Hilo. Volcano also offers full restaurant and bar facilities.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div>As one of the world's most unusual courses, it is set on the rim of the active Kilauea volcanic crater, lying in the cool highlands 4,000 feet above sea level. This makes for sweeping vistas of Mauna Loa and Mauna Kea Mountains - which both are typically snow-capped during winter-  and offers crisp, clean air for a truly enjoyable game of golf for players of all abilities.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div>Golfers looking for peaceful golf course offering ample time for concentration and a relaxing round should try the Volcano Club. Although fairly flat, the course does have some rolling hills which can cause uneven lies. Almost all of the tees and some of the greens are elevated. The most difficult hole on the course being the 425 yard par 4 15th, which requires a tee shot up a dogleg fairway with tall pine trees guarding the turn.</div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n<tbody>\n<tr style=\"background-color: 1 pm"]}]},{"id":168053352,"title":"Makalei Golf Club FT","handle":"makalei-golf-club-ft","body_html":"<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\"><b>18 holes, par 72, 7091 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental and bottled water. </b></span></div>\n<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\"><b></b></span></div>\n<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\"><b></b></span></div>\n<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\"></span></div>\n<div><span style=\"line-height: 1.5;\">At Makalei Golf Club Kona golf enthusiasts will appreciate the indigenous flora and fauna of the area, which includes many native species of plants as well as numerous peacocks, pheasants, wild turkeys and other wildlife. While the native plants and animals are enough for most people to enjoy the experience, Makalei also vaunts a spectacular view of Hawaii Island as well as one of Mount Haleakala on the island of Maui.<br><br>The par 72 golf layout is a scenic, lush forest alternative to the island’s coastal golf and will offer a great challenge for golfers of all skill levels. Situated in the Kona region on the west side of Hawaii Island, known for its cool climates and world famous coffee farms, Makalei boasts an elevation range from 1,800 to 2,850 feet. Several distinctive features on the course include Bentgrass greens, lava tubes, cinder cones and a stone wall dating back more than a century. Take some time to appreciate the many birds and spectacular views of the coastline throughout the course.<br><br>Makalei is a short drive straight up the mountain from the Kona International Airport and is easily accessible from all of the major resorts and destinations on the Island of Hawaii. Makalei offers player friendly prices, which make it one of the most affordable golf courses on the island. Makalei is truly one of the most unique golf courses in the world as it encompasses all of the serenity and challenge that the Island of Hawaii has to offer.</span></div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<div></div>\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2>Course 12 pm"]}]},{"id":129428507,"title":"Kona Country Club Mountain Course 2","handle":"kona-country-club-mountain-course-2","body_html":"<div id=\"course\" class=\"tabdiv\">\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\"><a href=\"#details\">Course Details</a> | <a href=\"#scorecard\">Scorecard</a> | <a href=\"#layout\">Layout</a> <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span> <span><span><span><span><span><span><span> <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>    <span>   <span> </span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><a href=\"http://hawaiiteetimes.com/products/kauai-lagoons-golf-course\" style=\"text-align: left;\"><img src=\"//cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0191/3924/files/2014_Rates_medium.png?7195\" alt=\"\"></a><!--Paste code here --></p>\n<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6509 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental.<br> </b></p>\n<div>With breathtaking panoramic views of the Kona coastline, the Mountain Course has its way of attracting beginners and advanced golfers alike. It features a cool mountain setting, manicured Bermuda greens, elevated tees, numerous bunkers and three lakes. Challenge yourself on the front nine as you experience elevation changes. After reaching the crescendo, all you see is a clear blue ocean, swaying palm trees and a panoramic view from Keauhou to Kona. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Mountain Course designed by William Bell, Nelson and Robin Wright offers breathtaking Kona coastline views, trails of ancient lava flows and is enriched with Hawaiian culture and wild life. The 7th hole, the number-one handicap 446-yard par four, is a favorite hole. This hole features an elevated tee shot to a narrow landing area, and two right fairway bunkers and impinging lava. Hole 14 is the highest point of the course and is the most picturesque hole. There is a waterfall surrounded by red bougainvillea and black lava rock, scenic lake and miles of ocean as far as the eye can see.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The Mountain Course is enriched in Hawaiian culture. This area was a favorite playground for Hawaiian royalties known as Alii. You’ll see Hawaiian wild goats moving throughout the back nine. Golf Digest Magazine rated the Mountain Course as 4 stars and ESPN, Zagat Guide recognized it as one of the top facilities in the nation.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>The front nine was designed by William Bell in 1985. The back nine was completed in 1991, designed by Rodney and Nelson Wright. Surrounded by this enchanting setting, your experience on the Mountain Course will linger in your memories.</div>\n<div></div>\n<a name=\"details\"></a>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table {"products":[{"id":1316311924815,"title":"Poipu Bay Golf Club","handle":"poipu-bay-resort-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7123 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls, bottled water and $5 resort fee. </b></p>\n<div>Poipu Bay Resort Golf Course was the home of the PGA Grand Slam of Golf from 1994 – 2006.  The course has won numerous awards and is consistently rated among the top golf courses in Hawaii and the U.S. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>This outstanding course is backed by lush emerald mountains and sculpted from a rolling plateau eight stories above the Pacific Ocean. Nestled among the gentle contours of Poipu Bay you’ll discover the remains of Hawaiian heiau (places of worship) and ancient stone walls. You also may even see rare Hawaiian Monk Seals, native Nene Geese, Green Sea Turtles or Humpback Whales. Whichever it may be you’ll have plenty of good excuses to back your scorecard, as sometimes even the most focused golfer can be challenged by the breathtaking views this course has to offer.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>This links style layout designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr. can play over 7000 yards long. The ocean comes into play on holes 15-17, a beautiful venue for golfers of all abilities. A unique and unforgettable golf experience awaits you at beautiful Poipu Bay Resort.</div>\n<p><br> <a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" ft","handle":"poipu-bay-resort-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7123 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls, bottled water and $5 resort fee. </b></p>\n<div>Poipu Bay Resort Golf Course was the home of the PGA Grand Slam of Golf from 1994 – 2006.  The course has won numerous awards and is consistently rated among the top golf courses in Hawaii and the U.S. </div>\n<div></div>\n<div>This outstanding course is backed by lush emerald mountains and sculpted from a rolling plateau eight stories above the Pacific Ocean. Nestled among the gentle contours of Poipu Bay you’ll discover the remains of Hawaiian heiau (places of worship) and ancient stone walls. You also may even see rare Hawaiian Monk Seals, native Nene Geese, Green Sea Turtles or Humpback Whales. Whichever it may be you’ll have plenty of good excuses to back your scorecard, as sometimes even the most focused golfer can be challenged by the breathtaking views this course has to offer.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>This links style layout designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr. can play over 7000 yards long. The ocean comes into play on holes 15-17, a beautiful venue for golfers of all abilities. A unique and unforgettable golf experience awaits you at beautiful Poipu Bay Resort.</div>\n<p><br> <a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" 12 pm","Morning (from Apr 1)","After 12 pm (from Apr 1)"]}]},{"id":2140049861,"title":"Hokuala Ocean Club ft","handle":"hokuala-ocean-club-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7156 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental, range balls and bottled water.<span><span color=\"#ff0000\" style=\"color: #ff0000;\">  </span></span></b></p>\n<p><span>The \"Ocean Course\" at Hokuala (Formerly known as Kauai Lagoons) is a lush, 750-acre resort carefully secluded in the southwest corner of the island of Kauai, Hawaii. Fairways weave through mango and guava tree forests along imposing ocean cliffs and over promontories high above the harbor.</span><br><br><span>It is said that when legendary golfer and architect Jack Nicklaus created the original Kiele Course in the late 1980's, the terrain lent itself so well to his vision that he made but a single change to his original design. In 2011, Jack Nicklaus was again called upon</span><span>, t</span><span>his time to redesign the back nine of his famed Kiele course. Included are all new greens, new white silica sand bunkers and three new holes. Arguably the best new feature is an </span><span>additional </span><span>ocean hole that is now the centerpiece of what is the l</span><em>ongest stretch of continuous ocean holes of any course in Hawaii</em><span>, now making four fabulous holes which provide over 1/2 mile of unobstructed oceanfront.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><a name=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table 12 pm","9 Hole"]}]},{"id":1316331749455,"title":"Royal Hawaiian","handle":"royal-hawaiian-golf-course","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6595 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental bottled water.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Formerly known as Luana Hills, Royal Hawaiian is located on the east side of Oahu at the base of the Ko'olau Mountain Range with colossal Mt. Olomana its background.<span> </span>The course is carved through a tropical rain forest and is known for its breathtaking views throughout.</p>\n<p>Royal Hawaiian Golf Course can best be described as playing golf in Jurassic Park without the dinosaurs! The astounding scenery begins right away with a 1.5 mile drive through a magnificent rain forest to get to the clubhouse. When you finally arrive there is no doubt that you will be amazed that a golf course could be built in such paradise.</p>\n<p>The Pete and Perry Dye designed layout has contrasting nines, with a front side that features a rugged mountainous terrain and a open rolling terrain back nine. With a slope of 138 from the back tees and a distance of about 6600 yards, this demanding track is certainly an interesting mix of beauty and challenge. Royal Hawaiian should definitely be on everyone's bucket list!</p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table Bird before 8:30 am (until Apr 30)","Morning","Rainforest 2 Day SPECIAL","Aloha Challenge","Blackout"]}]},{"id":109451554,"title":"Royal Hawaiian ft","handle":"royal-hawaiian-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 6595 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rental bottled water.<span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"> </span><span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Formerly known as Luana Hills, Royal Hawaiian is located on the east side of Oahu at the base of the Ko'olau Mountain Range with colossal Mt. Olomana its background.<span> </span>The course is carved through a tropical rain forest and is known for its breathtaking views throughout.</p>\n<p>Royal Hawaiian Golf Course can best be described as playing golf in Jurassic Park without the dinosaurs! The astounding scenery begins right away with a 1.5 mile drive through a magnificent rain forest to get to the clubhouse. When you finally arrive there is no doubt that you will be amazed that a golf course could be built in such paradise.</p>\n<p>The Pete and Perry Dye designed layout has contrasting nines, with a front side that features a rugged mountainous terrain and a open rolling terrain back nine. With a slope of 138 from the back tees and a distance of about 6600 yards, this demanding track is certainly an interesting mix of beauty and challenge. Royal Hawaiian should definitely be on everyone's bucket list!</p>\n<p><b> </b> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table Bird before 8:30 am (until Apr 30)","Morning","Morning (from May 1)"]}]},{"id":109451520,"title":"Ko'olau Golf Club-FT","handle":"koolau-golf-course-ft","body_html":"<p><b>18 holes, par 72, 7310 yards. All prices per person and include golf cart rentals &amp; range balls. <span style=\"color: #ff0000;\"><br></span></b></p>\n<p>Carved out of a magnificent tropical forest, Ko'olau Golf Club is one of the most inspiring golf experiences you will play anywhere in the world. Ko'olau is nestled below Oahu's historic and popular Pali Lookout, and offers breathtaking views of the majestic 2,000-foot-high cliffs of the Ko'olau Mountain Range, cascading waterfalls and calming views of the beautiful windward side of Oahu.</p>\n<p>Ko'olau's natural setting provided master golf course architect Dick Nugent the opportunity to create a gem of a golf course that encompasses over 280 acres of spectacular terrain with a scenic 7310 yard, par-72 layout unlike any other in the world.<span>  </span></p>\n<p>Considered by many the toughest golf course on the planet, Ko'olau was originally pegged with a slope of 162 from the back tees but later dropped to 152, just three points shy of the maximum value acknowledged in the slope rating system. Due to Ko'olau's alluring scenery and uniqueness it comes as no surprise that it is commonly found at the top of golf course lists created by trusted names in golf such as <em>Golf Magazine</em> and <em>Golf Digest</em>. </p>\n<p> </p>\n<!--Paste code here -->\n<p><a name=\"details\" id=\"details\"></a></p>\n<h2>Course Details</h2>\n<table class=\"details_course\" width=\"100%\" cellspacing=\"0\"
